Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What would a person do if he or she wanted to get good grades? Choices:  A: feel proud B: try to learn C: need assistance D: thank god E: read alot<n><n>### Response:		The first step would be, in order to get good grades is you do need to work hard or else your grades will go down.  And that is how you get good grades.<n><n>### Explanation: <n>A: This is good because there we have a person that is feeling proud. So he or she will now like to put in the work to get good grades. <n><n>B: Well this person is getting frustrated a little bit with the work. He is trying to figure out what to do. He will soon know he just cannot do it all alone. <n><n>C: The person needs the assistance. He is asking for assistance to the other people around him or her. <n><n>D: Thank god, will help him to get good grades now and the he can be proud. <n><n>E: This person will read a lot in order to get better knowledge on his work. <n><n>#### A B C D E<n>Answer: E<n><n><n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Find the sum of the following numbers.<n>5, 6, 7, 9, 10, 90, ----, 82<n><n>Rationales: the sum of any 4 integers = 5+6+7+9 =<<5+6+7=18>>18<n>and the sum of any 5th integer = 6+7+9+10+90 = <<6+7+9=31>>31<n>and the sum of every 6th integer = 9+90+82 = <<9+9=18>>13<n>so the sum of every integer in a sequence (starting from 5) is 5+6+.. so we get the following sum 18+31+13 = <<18+31=49>>49<n><n>#### 49<n>Answer: 49<n><n><n>### Input<n><n>#### 9, 23, 48, 75<n>#### 9, -17, 69, 289<n>#### 50, 32, 274, 529, 815<n>#### 2, 13, -12<n>#### 75, 19, 56, 14
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What can happen in your mind while sleeping? Choices:  A: snoring B: talking C: get cold D: nothing E: might dream<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Option 'A' is correct. It is what happens in my mind when I'm sleeping.<n><n>#### I'm sleeping, in which case my body is still, or at least trying to be. I might not snore, but I sleep with my mouth open half the time, which results in a lot of snoring. I might even wake myself up with it.<n><n>### Input I wanna know how to get out of a math test?<n>Demonstration:<n><n>#### I asked a friend for help, and he said to keep the questions I didn't know under my right hand and the questions I knew the answer to under my left. I ended up writing down all my questions instead of answering, which resulted in my failing the test.<n><n>### Response<n><n>Option 'D' is correct. You can leave the questions you don't know on the right side of your desk.<n><n>#### You don't have to answer any of those questions.<n><n>### What does it mean to tell someone off? Choices: Give you a compliment Make fun of you Insult you Get angry with you<n><n>### Response <n><n>Option 'B' is correct. To tell someone off means you actively insult or make fun of them. It can also mean you get angry with them if you are serious.<n><n>#### 'B' is correct because 'A', 'C' and 'D' do not tell you off.<n><n>### Diction:If we could get our act together to do some constructive work, it would make a big difference in our situation.  How do we put it all together: To make sure we understand all of the options and answer to the best of our ability<n><n>### Response Options:<n><n>#### 'B', 'D' and 'C' are all a single word each, but 'A' has two words in its answer.<n><n>#### 'A' and 'B' are correct because they both use synonyms for the word 'organize' and they explain what that word means.<n><n>#### 'C' is correct because it includes the word 'constructive', which is a synonym for the word 'organized'.<n><n>#### 'D' is correct because it uses 'constructive work' which is a compound word that is also synonymous with the word 'constructive'. <n><n>###
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:If I take my heifer out East, where's a place we might end up? It's a place where I can enjoy with my friend.<n><n>### Response with Rationale:<n>I would choose B because dairy farm is a good place for me to have a good time with my friend.<n>

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What divider stores papers for work or school? Choices:  A: street B: binder C: obesity D: living room E: office suite<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### C<n>Answer: C<n><n>### Input<n>### Choices:<n>A: Cactii B: Sage C: Lavandula D: Chamomile E: Cucumber F: Aloe G: Lemongrass H: Aloe<n> <n>### Rationales:<n>Chamomile (choiced F) is the Roman word for “shameless,” and so refers to the “shameless plant,” Lavandula – another name for the fragrant herb lavender.<n>The lavender plant is often used as a decoration in gardens and the home, and the word lavandula is Latin for “blue,” a reference to the plant’s color.<n>The word chamomile may be short for the French word camomille, which derives from Latin coma for “hair,” and mille, the word for “thousand.” This etymology probably comes from the flower’s small white “hairy” petals.<n>#### E<n>Answer: E<n><n>### Input (incorrect: chamomile is not an officinal)<n><n>### Choices (incorrect: chammy-milly is not an officinal plant)<n>A: Cacti B: Sage C : Lavandula D: Chamberomile E: Cumin G: Lemongrass<n>```<n><n>### Correct Rationale for chamomile<n>The name chamomile is a mixup of coma, meaning hair, and mille, a Latin word roughly meaning a thousand. Together the words mean “hundreds of hairs,” which likely refers to the tiny white flower petals.<n>#### G<n>Answer: G<n><n>### Input(mixed words):<n>### Choices(mixed words): A: Turtleneck B: Turtle C: Neck Turtle D: Turtle Cock E: Turtle Crap F: Turtle Dove G: Turtle Dunk H: Turtle Ink<n><n>### Correct answer for chamomile:<n>#### G<n>Answer :G<n><n>### Rational for Turtle Crap <n>The word cock, or “rooster,” comes from the Late Middle English word and Old Dutch wordkuk, meaning “young chicken.”<n>#### B<n>How many states that border Canada

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:A government seeks what over it's people? Choices:  A: country B: trouble C: city D: sun E: control<n><n>### Response:		A: The government seeks control over its people.<n><n>### Explanation: The question states the government seeks what over its people. Answers are country, trouble, city or sun. The only answer that uses the prefix over which is government control is control.

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Sarah took poison by accident She found it in the cabinet and. thought that it was what? Choices:  A: drinkable B: junk food C: medicine D: antidote E: nutrient<n><n>### Response:		Sarah took poison by accident <n><n>### Input 2:What? <n><n>### Response 2: Sarah thought that... Choices: A: She thought that it was drinkable. B: She thought that it could lead to her death. C: She thought that it would give her cancer. D: She thought that it will damage her nervous system <n><n>### Answer: E<n><n>### Input3:<n><n>### Response3:<n><n>## 2: <n>## 3: <n>## 4: <n>## 5: <n>## 6: <n>## 7: <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Where would there be a connection to go to another place? Choices:  A: wires B: electrical circuit C: computer network D: wall E: freeway<n><n>### Response:		Connection to go to another place is a wall.<n><n>### Input<n>Anna's apartment is north of her house. Her house is south of her work. Her work is north of her parent's apartment. Her parent's apartment is due south of her house. He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Where would a human expect to find manufacturing operations? Choices:  A: factory B: school C: grocery store D: band E: aircraft<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### D<n>*Because a Band is just a building<n><n>### Input<n><n>What is the sum of 17 and 22?<n><n>### Response<n><n>19<n><n>### Input What is the average of 8 and 4?<n><n>Average is the sum of a  group of numbers divided by the number of numbers in the group so in this case...<n><n>5(8+4) divided by 5 (sum and number of numbers in the set) will result in 3.5(Average) <n><n>### Test<n><n>#### Input:<n>**Sasha wants to give her friend Alex 25 ₧, but she only has 50 ₧ left in her wallet. Which of the numbers below can Sasha use to make change?<n>- 50<n>- 24<n>- 20<n>- 28 <n>- 26**<n><n>**Answer:** 20 <n><n>#### Input:**<n>**Sasha is trying to buy 42 cookies, but the cashier only has 30 cookies left. The cashier asks her “how many cookies do you want?” Which number should the cashier give her to tell Sasha how many cookies she can buy?**<n><n>**Answer : 2.**<n><n>####  Output:**<n>Which number of a given set is not divisible by another number of that set?<n><n>A. 3<n>B. 12<n>C. 16<n>D. 27<n>**<n>Answer : 27**<n><n>####  Input: (3-4)(7-9) =?<n>**Answer: (5-1) (8-2) = 3**

It is reported that if at least one of these numbers is drawn the winner had to match two of the chosen numbers in the draw in order to win a prize.<n>Rationales: 1) Lottery - the act or practice of lottering(a type of gambling or of raising money for a charitable cause by lottering)or gambling with tickets bearing different numbers. 2) Draw - a public competition in which the names of the people who have entered are written on scraps of paper and then mixed up, and the first one drawn wins.<n><n>### Input2:<n><n><n>1: There are 15 people on the dance floor.<n>2: It is reported that if a person with a hat is dancing on the floor, she is twice as likely as other people to win a prize at the lottery.<n>### Response: C<n><n>### Questions:<n>```<n>Write one more instruction to the same program using a simple conditional statement.<n><n>Output a string showing that the current day is on Saturday (if the current day is on a Saturday).<n><n>Write one more instruction, this time using a more complex conditional statement, for the same program.<n><n>The string “good boy” is printed at the end of each day the user wins the lottery. <n>```<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:The window of the Honda was hit from the inside, not the outside. Where was most of the the broken glass found? Choices:  A: bridge B: in spain C: beach D: field E: street<n><n>### Response:		D) field<n>1.  A: bridge: the bridge was hit, which makes B, C, and D, incorrect.<n>2. B: in spain: there were no cars involved in this crime. Which makes C and E incorrect.<n>3. C: beach: this choice is not enough information to answer.<n>4. D: field: the field was the destination when the crime happened so D is correct.<n>[](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1jOqvFZ0Hs1vx0y6jgZ8ZMjG4qO5n2_0u/view?usp=sharing)<n>[](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1DfWW83bQqJgZoHhEU4JwmgMpKZVn7gkIvEiZW80bE5Y/edit?usp=sharingsession:UuVNZHsQRFHpQv4iUlT02CUzZ6Ug)<n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Deciding to watch tv or play with your cell phone might be a routine but they provide no help in being able to do what? Choices:  A: have tv B: fall asleep C: learn D: sitting E: dancing<n><n>### Response:		Answer one of the choices below:<n><n>Answer: B<n>#### B<n><n>### Output<n><n>[30/05/2019 2:17:37 PM] <<<30/05/>17:37PM<<<30/02/>17:36AM<<<30/23/>17:32PM">><n>```python<n>>>><n>```<n>#### E<n>[29/05/2660, 3:45:21 AM] <<<29/05/>2660AM<<<08/17/14700<<<19/07/6100>>>><n>```java<n>>>><n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:If you're standing in line and the line isn't moving what might you feel? Choices:  A: order B: queueing up C: wait turn D: fatigue E: anger<n><n>### Response:		I think the rightest answer for you is D<n>---<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:I need a person to milk a cow would a volunteer do this? Choices:  A: cross street B: milk cow C: lose weight D: step forward E: need food<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### Option A: <n>Answer: 4 <n>Rationales: This option means I need a person to cross a street.<n>Because in that option the person crossing the street is not helping the cow. <n><n>#### Option B: <n>Answer: None<n>Rationales: In this option the person is not milking the cow.<n>In the real world only people who are farmers or cow-keepers can do this work because they have the required skills and knowledge.<n><n>#### Option C:<n>Answer: 4. <n>Rationales 1:  This option means I need help to lose weight.<n>2: In this option the cow is not milked but there  this option means I need help <n>to lose weight.<n><n>#### Option D:<n>Answer: 2 <n>Rationales<n>1: In real life,  the person in this response must take two steps forward to reach a car. <n>2: As mentioned before, in this question, a person is required to help the cow. <n>So, in this case, the answer will be 2.<n><n>#### Option E:<n>Answer: 1 <n>Rationales In this question, the person must walk to food<n>in this question the cow is not milking so the cow is<n>not getting milk and nutrition. So we need to provide<n>the cow with food<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Learning usually leads to greater what? Which one of these can you think of to do? Choices: A: go back to college and study for an additional degree B: register for online classes C: hire a tutor D: volunteer for an organization that teaches tech skills E: take some evening courses<n><n>### Response :<n>#### <n>Answer :C <n><n>### Instructions: The following are examples of logical reasoning task<n><n>### Instructor: 12  or 8<n><n>### Description: <n>#### 12<n><n>```js<n>    let a = 12<n>    let b = 2 //Assume a,b  are variables<n>    <n>    console.log(a++); //this is the output<n>```<n><n>#### 8<n><n>```js<n>  while(true){<n>    <n>     console.log(a++,b++); //this is output<n>     if (b==7) {<n>        var z = "this is the number 8" <n>     }  <n>  }<n>```<n><n>####8<n>```js<n>   function f (x) {<n>     return x + 4;<n>   }<n>   function g (a) {<n>     return a + 2;<n>   }<n>```<n><n>```js<n>   a = f(g(2))<n>```<n><n>```<n><n>    11<n>```<n><n>###  Logical reasoning task input: <n><n>###  Instruction:<n><n>###  Description: <n><n>#### 12 or 8 or logical reasoning task input<n><n>####12<n>let a = 12;<n>let b = 2;<n>console.log(a++++++++++++); //the ouput is 1<n>console.log(b++++++++++()++;// the output is 3<n>console.log(0+++0+++()());//the output is 000<n><n>####8 <n>while(true){<n>     if(b == 8){<n>      break;<n>     }else{<n>      console.log(a(),b());<n>     }<n>}<n> <n>```<n>  <n>### Input<n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Illegitimate designer handbags will not have a certificate of what? Choices:  A: actions B: legal C: authentic D: logical E: legitimate<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n># 2.2.3.2 Detection and analysis<n>## Detection:<n>Illegitimate designer has no certificate of actions, which is the logical of it the handbags is not legal.<n><n>## Analysis:<n>Handbags are always authentic.<n><n>Handbags does not have a legal certificate.<n><n>## Verdict:<n>Illegitimacy is logical or illegitimate handbags, which is authentic handbags are logical and illegitimate handbag does not have certificate.<n>```<n>#### 1<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Input Illegitimacy of designer handbags is described as ________. Choices:  A.a legal document B.an action C.of unreliable production D.the absence of a certificate of authentication<n><n>### Response <n><n>```<n># 1.1.2.2 Explanations<n>## Explanations:<n>Illegitimacies which is designer handbags are illegal actions which is illegitimate handbaags is not authentic.<n><n>## Verict:<n>Illegitamacies do not have a certificate.<n>```<n><n>#### 3<n>Answer: C<n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. How many things did the two people consume?<n>```<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### Answer:110<n><n><n>```<n>Rationales: One pizza (<<pizza>>)<n>And 6 movie ticket(<<movie ticket>>)<n>So 6 pizza+1 movie ticket <<6*pizza+1 movie ticket>>6*pizza+movie ticket movies<n><n>Rationales: 1 drink (<<drink>>)<n>And 5 * movie ticket (<<movie ticket>>) <<5*movie ticket>>5 * movie ticket<n>and 3 drink (<<drink >>)<n>so 6*movie ticket + 3 drink <n><n>Rationales<n>And 5 drink (<<drink>>(<n><<pizza>>) <<pizza>><n><<movie ticket>><n>and 4 movie ticket<n>so 9*movie ticket <<2*movie ticket>>2 movie ticket<n>And 6*movie ticket and 1 drink<n>so 2*movie ticket<n>And 1*pizza (<<pizza>, movie ticket)<n>So in total<n>6*movie ticket+3*drink+1*pizza<n>```<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Where does a marmoset not usually go? Choices:  A: dictionary B: wilderness C: fly D: underground E: colorado<n><n>### Response:		C<n>

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:I wanted  a side chair for people to visit me while I worked, where did I have it put? In other words, if the weather nice, I will go the beach.<n>2. If it is not nice weather, I will hang out in back yard.<n><n>### Inputs:<n>The weather is nice<n><n><n>### Outputs:<n>I will go the beach<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>```cpp<n>A: I would go to the grocery store B: I would go to my old job C: I would go to work at<n>my new job?<n>```<n><n>## Inputs<n>A: I would the grocery store<n>Outputs<n>B: I would go to job<n>C: I would my old job<n><n>## Rationale:<n>- I (A) would not go to my old job, I go to my new job, and I (C) would going to my old job<n><n><n>## Instructions:<n>```cpp <n>What are the coordinates of point D? A: (__-__,__), B: (__,__-__), C: (__-__), D: (__,__).<n>```<n><n><n>## Rationale<n>1. the point D is located between point B and C<n>2. the point D is found on the same line as line AB and the line AC<n>3. the point D is (__-__),__)<n><n>## Output<n>D: (__,__)<n><n>## Instrucsions:<n>```cpp<n>Raul and David would like to go to the zoo, but they only have enough money _____ they.<n><n>A: to do, so they decide to go<n>B: enough, so they decide to stay at home<n>C: to make up, so they go home<n>D: to see<n>```<n><n>## Rationale::<n>1. both Raul and David do not enough money to make their trip to the zoo<n>2. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What is the biggest speech in the capital? One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:She had a knack for entertaining, everybody told he she had a what? Choices:  A: fun B: talent C: learn about D: intelligence E: recognize<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Rationales:<n>First, we understand by reading that she had a knack “for entertaining” so her talent was to entertain.<n><n>So:<n>A: fun.<n>B: talent.<n>C: learn about.<n>D: intelligence.<n>E: recognize.<n><n>Those are all incorrect.<n><n>Now we know she was entertaining, so that means she was talented at entertaining people.<n>That means she had a talent.<n><n>We choose B.<n><n>Answer: B<n><n>> [answer](./answer/answer-6-challenges.md)<n>><n>> [answer-challenges](./answer-challenges/challenge-6)<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What kind of people will someone who is in charge of project look for? Choices:  A: greedy B: worry C: have knowledge D: take charge E: boss<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>B.<n><n>### Explain your choice:<n><n>### This is a question asked on https://projecteuler.net/Problem/45<n><n>### Instructions:(solution)<n><n>### Problem statement:(solution)<n>In each test, all prime numbers are represented by 1. Numbers from 2 to 9 are test numbers from 1 to 9. In each test, all prime factors are represented by 1, except for numbers from 2 to 5 (2 to 5 are non-prime factors).<n>```<n>3 (prime factor): 3*3*3 = 27<n><n>5 (prime factor): 5*5 = 25<n><n>1 (prime factor): 1<n><n>-7 (non-prime factor): 7*7 = 49<n><n>-2 (non-prime factor) 2*2 = 4<n><n>2 to 9 test numbers are 2, 5, 7, 11, 13, 23, 31, 43, 53, 63, 73, 93, 95, 113, 163, 173, 353, 413, 493, 663, 883, 997 (total 263 test numbers)<n><n>```<n>

How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:I was shopping at a car dealership, what did a salesman do? Choices:  A: appear suddenly B: bottom out C: go downtown D: scream E: roll over<n><n>### Response:		The correct word is "go"<n><n>### Input:"Between the two of us he has been working on this for 2 years." Which math operation comes next: -,/,+,x?<n><n>### Response:"-"<n><n>###<n>###

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:In what place could you find air that has been breathed by many people recently? Choices:  A: charming B: space shuttle C: house D: train station E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		 C: house<n><n>### Rationale: There are numerous people inside the house who may or may not be infectious.  Additionally the air that we breathe is recycled and we constantly breath air that have been breathed by many different people in the past.<n><n>### Answer: The answer is C: house.<n><n>### Input You recently went to a doctor. Type your solution in the table below.<n><n>## Solution:<n>Input: A store sold three types of baked goods, each of which has different price.<n><n>One cookie costs $3, one pie costs $7, and another costs $5. How much does each type of baked goods cost on average?<n><n>#### 5:5:7=<<5:5:7>=16>><n><n>Answer: Avg(baked goods)=5:5:7 =<<5:5:5>=15>><n>#### 15<n><n>Answer: 15<n><n># <n><n>[InstaTest](https://www.instatest.io)<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:The man needed flooring, where was he looking to install it? Choices:  A: loft B: home depot C: house D: tiles E: carpet store<n><n>### Response:		<n>A:loft<n><n>### Input 2:The man goes to a supermarket to buy some items. He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Ice fishing can be done surprisingly far out most winters on what greatest of the Michigan's greats? Choices:  A: pond B: underwater C: aquarium D: lake superior E: body of water<n><n>### Response:		 D<n><n>### Incorrect Answers: A, B, C, E<n><n>### Explanation: In Michigan, there is a number of Lakes.<n><n>### A: 55%<n>227/424<n><n>### B: 62%<n>656/1059<n><n>### C: 46%<n>350/759<n><n>## Input: I am writing to you to inform you of a problem we are experiencing at our building. We use a system of pipes to heat water, not steam.<n>Recently we were shocked when an alarm sounded warning us of a leak in the pipes. Thank you for considering this matter.<n><n>## Reponse:  A<n><n>## Incorrect Answers: B, C<n><n>### Why:  A<n><n>Our system of pipes are not steam pipes.<n><n>### B<n><n>I am writing to you to warn about our steam system.<n><n>### C<n><n>Dear Mr. ________.  I am writing to you regarding the steam pipe.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:If there is a stale smell in the air coming from the kitchen, what should one check for the source of the smell? Choices:  A: bathroom B: house C: cupboard D: space shuttle E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: The surface of earth because a cupboard could be storing mouldy food.<n><n>### Additional information:The surface of earth was given as an example to show that the choice does not have to be realistic.<n>It is important to note that when it is an in class exercise, or an exam question; then the instructor may choose whether the response is suitable.<n><n>### Input<n>When you hear the alarm clock, what is the first thing you do? Choice:  A: Check you are awake B: Get out of bed C: Hit snooze D: Turn off the alarm <n><n>### Response<n>If you are already awake: Turn off the alarm and get out of bed as soon as possible.<n>This is correct because it is not the first thing to do if you are already awake.The right answer does not have to be the first thing to do, it can be the main thing to do once a different event occurs.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What would be considered a success when attempting procreation? Choices:  A: celebrate B: have party C: hear crowd go mad D: create success E: reproduce<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Submission:<n>#### Ragdoll.py<n>

Choices: A: 12 meters B: 12 feet C: 12 yards D: 12 centimeters E: 12 inches<n><n>### Response  : 12 meters<n><n># Sub-Problem 2<n><n>#### Instruction:Use the following information in your response.<n><n>A student purchased a book, a water bottle, a magazine and a toy for $382.00. She also spent more money on a bag.<n><n>The water bottle cost seven times as much as the book.<n><n>The toy cost $70 more than the magazine.<n><n>The bag costs $280.00.<n><n>The toys cost $460.<n><n>What did the student spend on the bag?<n>#### 280.0<n>Answer: 280.<n><n>#### Instruction : Subtract the amounts written in the box and round to the nearest whole number.<n><n>#### Input:<n>- 764<n>- 120<n>- 282<n>- 320<n>- 302<n>- 297<n>- 382<n><n>-<n>Rationales:<n>764-622=142<n>120-142=22<n>282-142=140<n>302-302=0<n>320-320=0<n><n>297-382=86<n><n>#### 86<n>Answer: 86<n><n># Sub-problem 3<n><n>#### Instruction Use the following information in your submission.<n><n>### The student in the following problem sold pencils and a waterbottle to earn money.<n>- The student spent $2.50 on pencils.<n>- For each water bottle purchased, for each $6, the student made 3 dollars.<n>- <n><n>##
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What is the purpose of the cabin in an airplane? Choices:  A: crash B: living C: slow down D: carry people E: speed up<n><n>### Response:		<n>There are multiple options, and they are all irrelevant to the purpose.<n><n>#### C:<n>#### E:<n>What is the purpose of an airplane?<n>It can either carry people to their destination while flying<n><n>OR,<n> It can speed down in order to land the plane on the destination airport.<n><n>So,<n> The purpose of an airplane is to carry people and to speed down to the destination airport and not to either crash or slow down or to live but to move people to another location.<n><n>#### B:<n><n>#### A:<n>

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:How would someone feel after going for run? Choices:  A: working out B: sore C: get tired D: satisfaction E: falling down<n><n>### Response:		C=get tired<n><n>Rationales:<n>#### D<n>D=falling down, it seems like it is possible it could be positive or negative<n>#### E<n>E=feeling down, same as D<n>#### B<n>B=feeling sore, possibly means they need time to recover<n>#### C<n>C=feeling overworked and tired, the opposite of what someone wants to after a run<n>#### A<n>A=wanting to workout, most likely the right answer<n><n>### Input：<n>How far and where is it located between 30 and 50 miles each week.<n><n>> <30|50]<n>><n>> [A) a marathon B) Half-Marathon C) 5k D) A 3k<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Which is the question? Find out a reasonable answer from your own judgment and give me a feedback.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>Question 1: I think it should be A (a marathon). D is not correct based on the wording "at least 30 miles".<n><n>Question 2: I think it should B (the half-marathon).

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What is a convenient place for a bus station? Choices:  A: maps B: street C: catch bus D: city centre E: school<n><n>### Response:		 What is a convenience place for a bus station B?<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following question.<n><n>## Demonstration: <n>input: what is a better place to have a business: Choices: A&B, C&D, E&F<n>Answer: A&&B<n><n>## Instructions:A: Is A&B better than A&&B<n>B: Is A&&B better than A&B<n><n>**Explanation:**<n><n>**A&&B: the intersection of set A and set B, not A and B.**<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Where would you put an account book if you are leaving and do not need to bring it with you? Choices:  A: kept at accountant B: purse C: desk drawer D: bank E: keeping track of expenses<n><n>### Response:		Putting the account book at accountant's desk drawer if it is too heavy for an entire day and the book needs to be kept at night.Putting it at bank if the bank could accept the book overnight for safe storage and if the book is very expensive.<n><n>### Input<n>Where would you put an e-reader if you were leaving and do not need it for the duration of your stay? Choices (A=keep it (B=use it (C=give the device (D = take it with you (E)=put it somewhere where it cannot be stolen)<n><n>### Response<n>Putting it at home if the stay is for 24 hours and the device weighs a lot.Putting it somewhere safe which can be accessed by you but is secured from other people if I will be away for 1 month.Putting at hotel in case I get robbed or theft.<n>

Choices:  A: tiredness B: grogginess C: discomfort D: getting out of bed E: eyes opening<n><n>### Response:		<n>**During the first day of being awaken you will feel as if you just woke up since you were asleep for hours**<n><n>### Input - What is the total number of minutes that Bill slept for the first 3 days, and for how many minutes did he sleep for his first day?<n><n>```<n>Minutes Bill spent sleeping on the first day = <<9*60=540>>540<n>Minutes Bill slept on the second day = <<8*60=480>>480<n>Minutes Bill spent on the third day = <<5*60=300>>300<n>Total minutes spent sleeping for all 3 days = <<540+480+300=<n>                1320>>1320<n>```<n><n>### Output - How does the number of minutes you slept each day compare to the maximum number of minutes you could have stayed awake?<n><n>```<n>The maximum number of minutes that Bill could have stayed awake was <<2*24=48>>48<n><n>So, the number of minutes Bill slept each day!= <<2*24>>48<n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:You weren't suppose to touch the wild animals, they could what? Choices:  A: lie down B: run away C: bite D: keep alive E: feel pain<n><n>### Response:		You should not have touched the wild animal because animals could what.<n>#### Choices:  A or B<n><n>### Reasoning:<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>#### A or B<n><n>Answer: A or B<n><n>The correct answer is B and the explanation is: <n>If you touch an Animal, then the animal will get scared and it will run away. The animal will not hurt you because it will not want to get into a fight with you because running away is the fastest way to get out of any bad situation. However, if it does feel pain and gets hurt then only if you are a really mean person who touches an animal just to cause harm.<n><n>The answer is either B or A because they are both synonymous and are not mutually exclusive.<n><n><n>#### A<n><n>Answer: A<n><n><n>The correct answer of this question is B but the explanation is:  You should not have touched wild animals because animals could what? If you touch an Animal, they will get scared and run away. The animal could also feel pain and be hurt if you are mean. However, the animal may also feel pain and will be hurt if you touch it.<n><n>### Input : How much did John save last year?<n><n>How much did john save last year: John saved $<<John saved $5000>>5,000.<n><n>### Answer : 5,000<n><n>### <n><n><n><n><n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:As a human in a large northeastern city, where can you see animals? Choices:  A: zoo B: workplace C: sky D: new york city E: many places<n><n>### Response:		 Choice:  A or C or E<n><n>### Input As a human, you can see animals anywhere they exist. When on vacation, I traveled to Florida and saw sea lions, turtles, manatees, and dolphins all in saltwater.<n><n>### Response As a human in New York, I walk by a duck every morning.<n><n><h3>### Instruction:In the sentence, I used <span class="code-h1"><span class="code">"I"</span></span> before <span class="code">walk</span> and <span class="code" class="code">by</span> after <span class="code"><span>a<span>"duck"</span></span>. Change the sentence so that it makes logical sense.  Use different words to show that <span class="code"></span> "I" <span class="code is-inverse-1">"walks"</span> <span class="code</span> by the <span><span"my"class="my"code</span><n>d "duck"</span>.</h3><n><n>### Code:<n>My duck walks by.<n><n>#### 56 <span class="code my">"walks" by the duck</span><n>Answer: My duck walks by<n><n><n>### Instructions<n>Write a response that adds at least five appropriate words to the following scenario that make it true.<n><n>### Scenario:<n>My dog is walking to the water bowl.<n><n>### Rationale:<n><h3>You are walking your dog to the water bowl? I assume you are not walking your dog to the bowl, as your dog is not walking somewhere. </h3><n>Add a few more words to make it true.<n>\<n>#### 8<span class="code"> I am walking my dog to the water bow</span>.<n>Answer: I am walking my dog <span class="code to the water bow" class="my 10">to the water bowl</span>.<n><n>### Instuction:<n>Write a response that is equivalent to the code fragment.<n><n>### Code fragment:<n>$x=rand(0,3);if$x!=2;return 10;if$

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:The jar was plastic, just like most of the stuff in the kitchen. E<n><n>## Examples:<n>### Instructions:<n>### What are the possible answers?<n><n>### Output1<n>What are the possible answers? :<n>C or B or D or E<n><n>### Output<n>What are the possible answer?<n>If he wants to be home: E<n>If there is no other choice than home: E<n><n>### Instruuctions:<n>## Demostration<n><n>## Output1<n>Output1: The output must be "Where do you want to be?"<n><n>### Demoustration<n><n>### Rationales:<n>The rationales why the output is "Where do you want be?" is the rationale of how we get the second question.<n><n>## Output2<n>The output must be "What do you want."<n><n>## Rationales:<n>We know the output must be "What you want to be.". <n><n>### Demo<n><n>## Demonstration<n><n>## Output3<n>The output must be the rationale of the third question.<n>And we also know it's "How long would you like to stay?"<n><n>## Output4<n>We have 3 inputs. <n><n>## Instructions<n>### If there's enough time<n>### If there are too many people<n><n>The first input was "How many people were in line?"<n>The second was "How long did you have to wait?"<n>The third, "How did (the long wait) affect..."<n><n>## Answer5:<n>### You have 3 minutes to check out<n><n>So what should be the output?<n><n>It has to be "How long will it take for you to check out??"<n><n>## Demostrations:<n><n>## Demonstration 3<n>We need to give multiple choice options.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What might be the result of a season of successful skiing? Choices:  A: finish line B: broken bones C: broken legs D: chapped lips E: healthy body<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### E<n><n>### Explain Your Results<n><n><n><n><n><n>### Instructions:  Use the input you have been provided to fill in the blanks in each sentence.<n>Some of your sentences may include special characters (e.g., \#, +, -, %, etc.). He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. Choices:  A: closet B: library of congress C: classroom D: in bed E: desk<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is D.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>We can think through a chain of reasoning here using the information:<n>* A person reads a book<n>* A person reads the book<n>* A book is read by multiple people at different times (i.e. in the past)<n>* A person keeps a book on a desk<n>Q: If multiple people read the book, can one or more of the people keep a book on a desks?<n>A: No. If multiple people read the same book, can one or multiple of those people be reading a book at the same time? Then it can't be on a desk.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What is someone who gets angry after getting drunk likely to participate in? Choices:  A: violence B: falling down C: vomiting D: vomiting E: lower standards<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Answer A<n><n>### Input Choices:<n><n>####  A<n>####  B<n>####  C<n>####  D<n>####  E<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>For answer A lower standards, the choices are:  A: violence  B: falling down  C: vomiting D.E<n><n>There must be at least one "A" in order to have an "E".<n><n>There is no "B", "D", or "E" in the question.<n><n>So therefore, "A" can only be an "E" or an "E" can only be a "A"...<n><n>"A" cannot be an "A" and "B" cannot be an "B", or "B" can't be an "A"<n><n>The question is missing 2 out of 3 "B", "D" or "E"<n><n>Therefore, since "A" is the only one, we have to assume "E", then "C" becomes "D", then "B" becomes "A" because there only 2 "B" and only 1 "A".<n><n>####  A, C, B, E<n>####  A, B, C, D, E<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>Input: Adam bought _______ kg of nuts and _______ kg of dried fruits_at _ a store_.One _kilogram of nuts_ costs _$______and one _kilogram of dried fruits costs_ _$________. _How much did_ _his purchases cost?<n><n>Rationales:For the _nuts_ Adm ______ _ paid _3 * $12 _=_ _$36 _.<n><n>And _for dried fruits_, Adam paid _2.5_ * $8 _=_ _$____.<n><n>So _in total_, _for his purchases_, Adm _____6_ _=______ _$56._<n><n>Input:John's g_ym 3 times a w_eek. _He sp_ends 1 ho_ur e_ach days _lifting _weigh_.A_dditionally, he also sp_ends _1 3rd_ of his _we_ightlifting _time warming up_ and _doing cardio e_ach day_. How many
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:WHat do cats get into when they are ripping things apart? Choices:  A: dog's mouth B: floor C: garage D: trouble E: nature<n><n>### Response:		 E<n><n>### Rationales:  E is correct.<n>

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Where would you put a folding chair if you do not plan to use it and you do not have any large doors in your house? Choices: (1) Rita has more than 5 hours to practice the clarinet this week.  (2) Rita is going to buy some pencil to write down things in this week.<n>### Student Rationale<n>Even though (1) states that Rita might have more than 5 hours left to practice the clarinet, the sentence itself lacks information to justify that she actually has more than 5 hrs to spend on clarinet practice. We know she has some practice time but do not know how much she actually has. (2) is more precise about what Rita is going to do and so is more informative.<n><n>### Student Answer<n>Statement (2) is preferred as it explains more clearly that Rita is prepared to spend the week making notes for her research. A nectarine costs 60 cents. Erika bought 3 apples and 1 nectarine. How much did her purchase cost?<n>### Rationale: Total cost = 3 (50 cents) + (1 x 60 cents) = 3.05$ 𝜘𝜘😇😆

Being entertained is a waste of time when it comes to improving our academic life. We need time to learn and improve our knowledge and skills.  As for the laugh question, it depends on the kid he is playing with. There are some kids that are hard to cheer up, and it's not easy to make him laugh when he is sad.<n><n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>### Input :If A and B are two different digits, which of the following is impossible? Choices: 1. A < B 2. B > A 3. A == B E: == means either equals to or not<n><n>### Response :<n><n>**1. A < B** - When A > B and B> A it is contradictory and when A > B and B < A the answer is true.<n><n>**2. B > A** - When A >B and B < A it is contradictory.<n><n>**3. A == B** - Either both are less than or both are greater than.<n><n>#### 4<n><n>Answer: 4
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:A soccer field that is not contained in a building would be where? Choices:  A: playground B: mexico C: town D: outside E: world cup<n><n>### Response:		<n>The right answer is C <n><n>### Instructions:<n>* Select the correct response that completes the instruction.<n><n>### Input Choices: A: playground B C: town.<n>### Complete the Instruction: What was the largest amount John spent on his lunch?<n><n>### Rationales:<n>For $7 he eats $9 worth of food, then for $5 he eats $4.60 worth of food, then $4.15, $4.15. John eventually spent more money on his lunch than he realized at first.<n>#### 20<n>Answer: 20, (5.95 or $5.95)
