Choices:  A: panic B: getting in trouble C: mass hysteria D: go to prison E: murder<n><n>### Response:		D: go to prison<n><n>## 3.5-page response.<n>### Instruction Use the information from this unit to write a detailed response to the following scenario.<n>### Task In a few days, you will board a ship for 24-hour excursion to study the ocean from a scientist’s perspective. The experience will include watching bioluminescent creatures of the night and studying corals of all shapes and sizes (and some you may not want to see!). To prepare for your journey, your teacher has created a checklist to help the class remember the essentials.<n>### Checklist Take a hard copy of your list with you<n><n>Clamor is an ocean sound that can be compared to waves crashing on the coast.<n><n>Dawn refers to the phase of the day, usually from around 5 a.m. to around 8 a.m. It can also refer to a specific moment in time.<n><n>A tide chart details current information about tides, such as where they are, what time they are happening, and when they will change.<n><n>Neolithic refers to a time period that starts around 11,000–10,000 B.C.E.<n><n>A barrier reef is a ring-like natural structure that is formed by coral colonies. A coral reef is essentially the same thing, but with corals being the building blocks that form it.<n><n>Submersible is an underwater craft or machine that can dive.<n><n>Explore describes a situation where someone investigates a particular area.<n><n>Sand bar is a shifting land mass formed under the sea by sediment of small sand particles.<n><n>Bait is a material that draws animals such as fish from nearby underwater areas.<n><n>Blowhole is a hole or opening from which water, air, or other substances are blown.<n><n>Seamount is a tall, isolated undersea hill or peak rising from the sea floor. The term seamount can also refer to an island.<n><n>Reef fish are fish that live and make their home near coral reefs.<n><n>A coral reef can also be called a rocky shore reef or a wave-cut platform reef.<n><n>Hurricane is the name for a storm that occurs in the ocean of the Atlantic

Choices:  A: read book B: getting bored C: worry D: singing E: s never comes<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>* Choices A, B and D are incorrect.<n>* Choice C is incorrect because the people are waiting for another thing.<n>* The people are bored for sure.<n>* You can agree with Adam that his purchases cost 56, and Johns goes to the Gym 4 hours every week.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What would something be if you do not need it? Choices:  A: satisfied B: unnecessary C: luxury D: sufficient E: extra<n><n>### Response:		I could get by with only getting 2,000 calories a day if I am satisfied with 2,001.<n><n>

Choices:  A: doctor's office B: hospital C: apartment D: study E: furniture store<n><n>### Response:		In a doctor’s office, hospital, or an apartment, there are furniture that can be used only by few people, those that belongs to one person.  In a furniture store, however, there are many furniture that can be taken out of the store and used by one person. That’s why an armchair can be easily found in a furniture store.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:How often are secular parties held? Choices:  A: short term B: crowd C: unpredictable D: frequent E: eternal<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>### Demoiselle:<n><n>### Response Input:<n><n>### Demi-Femme:<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>### Vestal:<n><n>### Dame:<n><n>### Temptation:<n><n>### Instructions:In the previous question, you were asked to choose one of the following:<n><n>### A: short term<n><n>```<n>    For 1 week<n>```<n><n>### B: crowd<n><n>```<n>    A group of people<n>```<n><n>## E: Eternal<n><n>```<n>    All of time<n>```<n><n>## C: Unpredictable<n><n>```<n>    Inexact times<n>```<n><n>## D: Frequent<n><n>```<n>    Several times per year<n>```<n><n>*Even if the time is not the same per occurrence, frequent describes 20+ times per year.<n>## Question:<n><n>### Input 168<n><n>### Instuction 56<n><n>### Rationales 20/60<n><n>### Example 560/180<n><n>### Answer 560<n><n>## Demoiselle 15
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What will happen to your knowledge with more learning? Choices:  A: headaches B: bigger brain C: education D: growth E: knowing more<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: John spends 60 minutes at the library each day. Average time it takes him to walk to the library is 25 minutes. What is the average walking speed?<n>Input:  The number 14 is a prime number.  If it were prime, what would be its factors?<n>Input:  If your mom and father were your brother would they still be your parents?<n><n>### Solution 1:<n><n>```python<n>input_str=input().strip().split()<n>if input_str[1]=="Headaches":<n>    print(input_str[2]) <n>else:<n>    print("No headaches")<n><n>input_str=int(input())<n>if input_str >=0:<n>    print(input("headaches"))<n>else:<n>    if input_str ==1:<n>        print("yes")<n>        print("Average number of books")<n>    elif input_str ==2:<n>        print("no")<n>        print("No Average books")<n>    elif(input_str ==3) :<n>        print("yes",input_str)<n>    else:<n>        print("error")<n><n>```<n>### Solution 2:<n><n>![image](https://github.com/Yogi-The-Coder/Yogi-Py-Tutorials/blob/main/input1.JPG)<n><n>### Solution3:<n>![image](https:github.com/Yoni3000/AskYoni/blob/main/image1.png)<n><n><n><n><n>

D: 9/4=<<9/4>>2.25<n><n>### Rationales:<n>1.  sum:  A: 13, B: 9<n>2.  14-12=<<12+12>>14 sum<n>3.  a/b: A: 20, B: 5<n>4.  9-4=<<3-3>>6 same

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What does exercising immediately lead to? Choices:  A: relaxation B: exhaustion C: energetic D: become stronger E: use energy<n><n>### Response:		
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:There is a lot of sugar in what food that fits in your hand? Choices:  A: cupboard B: chocolate C: coffee D: candy bar E: soda pop<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input : Is this sentence correct? Choices :  A: The teacher told the children to study hard. <n><n>### Response : Yes, because "study hard" is a gerund.<n><n>### Input  : Choose the best replacement for it  A: you should study with your best friends B: no, it needs a pronoun C: you must study as long as it is <n><n>### Choices  :  you need to use a pronoun D: it takes long or so long<n>A: you need to study with your best friends<n>#### you need to study with best friends<n>#### No<n>#### Not so long<n>#### study as long as it takes<n><n>#### Study as long as it takes.<n>#### Study hard.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:We want to try some new barbecue sauces, where should we buy some? Choices:  A: detroit B: australia C: michigan park D: cafe E: retail store<n><n>### Response:		The first step to decide where to buy some barbecue sauce, is to read what each place represents. Then we can use the information to identify the best place to shop. From the above questions, we know that A is from Detroit. In addition, there is another rule that the place from each letter should contain the same quantity of each letter. C does not have the quantity of place of Michigan as there is no mention of Michigan park in this question. Thus, A is best for barbecue sauces.<n><n>We can also apply another step to solve this question. We can find out the minimum quantity of each letter and we can choose the place that meet the minimum quantity of each place. For example, retail store have the minimum letter of the place.<n><n>Since retail store has the minimum letters, it should be chosen.<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:The banjo finds it's history in the Caribbean, but it's probably most famous where? Choices:  A: music shop B: music store C: jug band D: united states E: among nice people<n><n>### Response:		Among Nice People<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Rationales: The banjo has found its way from the caribbean to the United States so therefore 1* A=<<1*A=B>>B1<n>That is 1* B = C<n>Again to be C, we multiply each step to see how many times it was found by a nice person. Because 1* B > <1*B=A>>A so A * 1 < <<1*A,A>>12<n>Because 2* A < <<2*A,B>>22 and 2 * B < <<2*B,C>>23<n>Therefore A * 2 < <<2*A*1,A*2>>22<n>and  B* 2 < <<2/2*B*1,B*1>>23.<n>That is 2* C < <<2*A/2,B/2>>2 * 1<n>So C < <<2*C/2>>2.<n>Therefore C < <<2*1/2,1/2>>>>21<n>And since C in this scenario > 0 and A = B = C, we can conclude that the banjo is found most in United States<n>#### A2<n>Answer: A2<n><n>### Input<n>Input: Jake doesn't want his pizza to be cold and he is wondering if he can reheat the pizza in the backyard. How long would it take to heat up in his backyard?<n><n>### Response<n>It took 10 minutes to heat it up in his backyard. <n><n>Rationales<n>Input: 10min/25=<<10/25=A>>A5<n>Input: A*24=<<A*24=B>>B48<n><n>Answer<n>Answer: 48<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>### Demos<n>Input: Which of these animals is the heaviest? Choices:  P: chameleon  Q: hippo  R: tazmanian devil  S: chimpanzee  T: koala<n><n>Response: P<n><n>Rationales: Hippo is lighter than T, S, and R.<n>Therefore, T, S/2 is heavier than Q and Koala.

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What does someone need to do to begin creating art? When you give a choice, there should always be one more option as "not chosen." It can't be "A" or "B"):B is not correct.<n>It's not a group of similar cells.<n><n>### Examples(Remember this should be relevant, meaningful, and helpful information.<n>There is no wrong format,<n>you may use bullet points or numbered formats):<n><n>### Input(<n>### **Tips:**<n>### **Teacher input:**<n>#### 2<n><n>### **Expert input:**<n><n>#### 2<n>#### 2<n>### **Tutor input:**<n><n>### **Student input:**<a href="https://codepen.io/adambelanger/pen/ZEbPQoE">See the Pen <a href="https://jam.net/u/adambelanger" target="_blank">CodePen by AdB</a></a> by Ad <a href="https:……<n>### **General instruction:**<n>#11<n><n>### **Tutorial instructions:**<n>

How long is he likely to be lost if he eats 35 hamburgers per day?<n><n>Rationales: We know that the burgers have 400 calories each. So in a day, the guy gets 1400 calories. According to our nutritional data, he needs 2600 calories per day. Thus, from 2600 - 1400 = 1200, he is consuming extra.<n><n>#### 1200<n>Answer: 1200

Choices:  A: pet shops B: new mexico C: white house D: arctic E: garden of eden<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Description:<n>Choices that have not been explained are A (pet shops are not likely to care about warm weather, nor likely to have to care about hot temperatures either, but they may not want a cold bite while they work), B (New Mexico is known to be a desert), C (the White house is obviously controlled by humans, and thus, is not free to move locations. If it did, it would be moving to a hot place instead of a warm place.), D (the Arctic Circle is definitely the coldest place one can move to, and thus, a snake wants to avoid. However, it is also unlikely that a cage could contain a snake if the weather is too cold), and lastly, E (Garden of Eden is like New Mexico, it is known for its desert landscaping and cold.<n><n>### Difficulty Level:<n>There is no difficulty rating required for this task, which is why it is placed here.<n>

It didn't matter.   He didn't heave anything to put it on, and he lacked the what to balance it? Choices:  A: tenacity B: hands C: coaster D: skill E: breaking<n><n>### Response:		D<n>In answer part I of this response we used the phrase “he lacked the what to break.”  This is a substitution as in the example below.<n>“My house is small, and I lack the what to expand it.”<n><n>So to complete this task we substitute “to break” for “what” in the following phrase.<n>“My house i ssmall, and I lack the ____________ to expand it.”<n>Rationales: The cup set on the table It didn't matter the man didn't heave the cup.<n><n>### He didn't heavethat the man lacked the what to put the cup on.  And he too lacked he too hands he could put that the man lacked the  what skills or coasters he needed to balance the cup.<n><n>The man lacked the What to break.<n>So the man didn't the man lacked the What  to put the cup on and lacked the skills or coasters, or hands that he would need to balance the cup.He too lacked to balance the cup the man lacked the skills. <n>####  B<n>Answer: A: Tenacity<n><n>### Input : the girl's father took her for a birthday dinner. The more change she gives, the higher the tips. The local store buys rolls of quarters and dimes. She has to keep a record of what coins she needs to buy, and if she is short, the local store sells her more for a low price. Her quarters need to cost 90 cents each for selling at a dollar each. Her dimes have been increasing in cost by 9 cents each per week. How many of each can she buy? She has $240 in change to buy from the store.<n>### Rationales:<n>There are two coins in a dollar.<n><n>Dimes costs her 90 cents and is worth a dollar.<n>Quarters costs her 9 cents more each than dimes, which means in order for it to be cheaper, she must buy a higher volume of quarters.<n>Therefore, she needs to buy 200 dimes and 60 quarters.<n><n>#### $<n>Question 2:<n>10-point multiple choice questions<n><n>#### $<n>Answer:<n>#### $

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Where do you put your grapes just before checking out? Choices:  A: mouth B: grocery cart C: super market D: fruit basket E: fruit market<n><n>### Response:		D for which is grapes??<n><n>### Instructions:Choose the correct response for the following task<n><n>### Response A: My mother gave me a present on the 24th day of the month. She doesn't usually give presents during the month of April.<n><n>* My birthday is on the 24 day of April.<n>* My birthday was on the 24 of April.<n>* I celebrate a birthday on the 24 or April.<n>* I have a birthday on the month of April<n><n>#### 0<n>Answer:0<n><n>### Response B: The movie cost $4.25 per ticket. The ticket price is $4.25.<n><n>* The movie ticket cost $4.2.5 per ticket.<n>* The movie ticket costs $4.25 each.<n>* The movie tickets cost $4.2 per ticket.<n>* Movie ticket prices are $4.25<n><n>#### 0 <n>Answer:0<n>### Response C: A friend gave me $3, but she spent it $2.50 before I got it.<n><n>* My friend spent 3 $2.50 on me.<n>* My friend gave me 3$<n>* I owe 2.5 $ to my friend.<n>* I paid a friend $2.50.<n><n>#### 0 Answer:-0<n>### Response D:The city of Tampas police arrested 20 people and the city council condemned it.<n><n>* The city of Tampas was condemned and they arrested 20 people.<n>* The city of Tarpon Springs was condemned 20 and was arrested but the city council didn't condemned 20.<n>* The city council condemned 20 people. The city council condemned the police for arresting 20 people. <n>* The city council and the city of Tampas condemned the police.<n><n>#### 3 Answer: 3<n>### <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Of all the rooms in a house it was his favorite, the aromas always drew him to the what? Choices:  A: yard B: basement C: kitchen D: living room E: garden<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input 2:How many rooms are in the apartment he is renting? Choices: A: one B: two C: three D: four<n><n>### Response 2:<n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input3:How much foodstuff is in the freezer? Choices: A 10 kg B: 5.8 kg C 6 liters D 14 kg E : 3 kg<n><n>### Response3:<n>#### D<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Input4:Father and son are going to eat together later after which he says ‘ I ‘ m going to clean up the room.’ To which the son replies ‘ No you ‘ re not because I am going to do the dishes’ to which the father replies ‘ Okay, let’ s split it’ how should the father react? Choices A: Be glad because he does not have to clean up the room B. React rudely because of the son’s attitude C. be mad because of the son’ s attitude Choices<n>#### C<n>Answer: C<n><n>![Instructon][1]<n><n><n>[1]: https://res.cloudinary.com/sadey21/image/upload/c_fit,f_auto,fl_progressive,h_1034,w_2048/v1/blog/sadey/1558291611_589558789_4.jpg<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Where would you expect to find a pizzeria while shopping? Choices:  A: chicago B: street C: little italy D: food court E: capital cities<n><n>### Response:		 D<n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. Choices:  A: freeway B: radio C: wires D: computer network E: electrical circuit<n><n>### Response:		<n>A:<n>Rational: Radio waves travel through the air. They are transmitted from a radio tower to a receiver. To send information to one another devices on the internet, you need a connection. Radio waves are like the electrical circuit. This is the closest answer that resemble a circuit<n><n>Adapted from the following:<n><n>### How to answer<n><n>### A) Radio waves<n>B) Wires<n>C) An electrical circuit<n>D) A computer network<n>E) Computer network<n><n>### Question:What is the best answer?  Radio waves, Wires, Computer network, All of these choices is the best <n><n>### B) Radio waves<n><n>### C) Wires<n><n>### D) The computer network<n><n>### E) Computer network<n><n><n>### Explanation<n><n>### When two or more devices join together on the same computer network, they form a computer network. These networks are connected through the internet by connecting to the same computer network.<n><n>#### References<n>https://www.quora.com/What-is-an-Internet-network<n><n><n><n>

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week. Choices:  A: advisory B: mandate C: soap opera D: elective E: optional<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### A.<n><n>> An advisor<n><n>The advisory became mandatory, so, when will the advisory cease?<n><n>> Mandatorily<n><n>The mandate was mandatory, so, would you like to keep it on or off?<n><n>> Manda-<n><n>The mandate came on the mandatory TV, so, what did John eat?<n><n>> Mantra<n><n>The mandate became mandatory, so how did you deal with it?<n><n>> Manag<n><n>The soap started to melt, so what did the manager yell?<n><n>> Man-<n><n>The soap opera became mandatory, so the manager washed dishes.<n><n>### Input<n><n>> At what point did we all know that life is not only about doing what we want and doing what we like but also doing what we should do like being responsible and helping others?<n><n>> At what time point will you get $50 off the new Iphone?<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### A. 8am<n><n>> At 8am, life, Iphone, responsibility became a part of our lives, so at what point does this happen?<n><n>### Inputs:<n><n>#### A: Choice: $20 B: Choice: $40 C: Choice: $60 D: Choice: $80 E: Choice: 100<n><n>> What are the benefits of making a profit for $50?<n><n>#### A: This is not a trick question. The benefits of making a profit of $50 are that you get the cash of $50, which is beneficial for you.<n><n>> What were the benefits of buying your $70 jeans with a $10 discount at your favorite brand?<n><n>#### A. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:They decided to hash things out over drinks, after enough booze they were able to get close on a few things and what? Choices:  A: reach tentative agreement B: suicide C: examine thing D: commit murder E: stay in bed<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>Answer: A<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## #7:<n>## Input: A new bike shop opens and only sells two brands of bikes: Trek and Giant.<n>In one month, the only two types of bikes sold together sold to total to 56 bikes. The average price of the Trek Bikes is $110, and the average price of Giant bikes is $70. If 7% of the bikes sold on Trek are special edition bikes. How much did the bikes cost, and how many giant bikes were sold?<n>Rationales : I know $110 * 15% = $<<110*15%=16.5>>16.5 bikes out of total bikes sold<n>In addition, Giant Bikes cost $70*85% = $<<70*85%=58.5>>58.5 so in total I know $116.5 + $58.5 = <<110+20=130>>130<n>Answer: 130<n><n>## Input:  You walk into the library. Your average walk speed is 2 miles per hour (mp/h), and your average run speed is 5 mp/h. How long does it take you to walk or run 75 yards (<100 meters) and why?<n>For walk: 75/2 = <<75/2=37>>37 seconds to walk 75 yards<n>for run: 75/5 = <<75/5=15>>15 seconds to run<n>For total time: <<37+15>>37+15 = 52<n>Answer: 52<n><n>### Response1#: Choose the best option to complete the sentence.<n><n>## Input: There are 430 feet in a mile.<n>430 ft = <<430 ft=1/20>>1/20 yards.<n><n>## Input<n>The population of Chicago is 2.752 million.<n>39.3% of the population are female.<n>The population of male Chicagoans are <<1/2>>1/2 of all Chicagoans.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Though she made the cut years ago, its figurative scars would never what? This is because a foot cannot communicate back to the head, much less yell back.<n>```<n>If they are yelling at a subordinate, it might make sense, but I believe it is much more likely that they are yelling at their boss, the owner.<n>They are trying to tell their boss something.<n>```<n><n>### Input<n>Choices: a: 0 b: 10 c: 11 d: 12<n><n>I think that the answer is answer(d) (12). I can see the three legs of triangular formation. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:John was punching and punching at the wall but succeeded only in bloodying his knuckles. This was bad.  He would be unable to hold his tools if he injured what? Choices:  A: hostility B: anger C: nose D: fists E: hands<n><n>### Response:		Anger<n><n>

Write an if statement, then statements, that can compare them and outputs their sum.<n><n>## Instructions:<n><n><n>## Response:<n>Rationales<n>First thing, I thought was what to do to check if the first statement was true and if it was i should add it to my output variable so i used if else if statement<n><n>### Answer :<n><n>#### Answer : <n><n>```python<n>if x > y:<n>    print x+y<n>else:<n>    if x<y:<n>        print x-y<n>else:<n>print x+y<n>```<n><n>### Demositration<n><n>## Input: The weight of a piglet is calculated using the following formula: pi(x)= 85(x-50) + 125, pi(x) in pounds. x is the age of the piglet in days. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What is the hope of playing sports without competition? Choices:  A: running B: have fun C: balls touch D: winning E: get tired<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Rationales:<n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. Input: <n>You have a $100 grocery budget.  Choose one of the following choices:<n>A:  $300 worth of food B:  $400 worth of food C:  $200 worth of food D:  $450 worth of food E:  $155<n>You want to spend as much money as you can within the boundaries of the budget. The rest went to bills.  Now the student wants to know how much they have in the bank at the moment.  What is your response to this request?<n><n>## Demonstration<n>Rationales: R = $600<n>Rent = $120<n>R rent%20of$600 =<<Rent%20of$ 600=120>>120<n>Transportation = $90<n>Transportation = <<transportation = 90%35%of$600$600*90/100>>90<n>And $60

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Where are people likely to stand at an intersection? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:John moved away from his family.  He was a bit upset that he had to do it, but he needed the job.  Still, he would have preferred it if the job were what? Choices:  A: present B: stay here C: closer D: available E: come here<n><n>### Response:		<n>We can do away this task in the following steps.<n>-  Use $ and'for the operations<n>-  Use a number sign # for the equal sign and + for the operation sign for the whole task<n>-  Use a minus sign – for subtraction and an X sign × for multiplication<n>-  Use the = for division operation sign and the = for integer division<n><n>For the question:  John moved away from his family,  we can do away following steps:<n><n>- $John$ $moved$ $away$ $from$ $his$ $family$<n>- $job$ $needed$ $the$ $it$ $up$ $a$ $bit$ $upset$<n>- $closer$ $d$ $here$ $come$ $available$ $job$ $present$ $this$ $need$<n><n>$=John$ $moved\ away\ from\ his\ family$ \<n>$=\left(John\right)$ $move$ $away$ $his\ family$ \<n>=$John$ $moved-\left(job-\ need-\ come-\ here\ right\ close\ bit upset\ stay_ a\ bit\ upset\ away\ from\ family\ move-\ here\ of\ come\ come\ move$ \<n>='$Johnmov$\ away$ $from\ $"$ $family$<n><n><n>### Input:-25 $y^{3}$-$x^{4}$.<n><n>### Output:$225x+250+10$.<n><n>### Explaination:-<n><n>    #Substitute "25" for y<n>    #25^3 = 625<n><n>    #Subtract "x^4" from 1000(25^4)<n>    -x^4 = 1000 - (25^4) = 100 - 625 = 525<n><n><n>### Output:<n>225-0x+525<n><n>### Concept-Sub-straction<n>### Input:-5<n>### Output:-5<n>### Expliction:-<n><n>Sub<n>  -11239009082348.625-5=3.375<n><n>### Explicition:-<n><n>**[

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What does a chef do when working in the evening? One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What do people in the same family often share? Select the most accurate way.<n><n>### Option 1:The product of one and four over 10.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>This equation is ambiguous because 14/10 is greater than one.<n><n>### Answer:Option 2<n><n>### Option:<n>```<n><!doctype math><n><head><n>	<title><n>	<n></title><n><n>```<n><n>### Content<n>14/10<n><n>### Explanation<n>```<n><p>14/10<bstyle>-</bstyle></p><n><n><p>The first number is: <bstyle>-14</bstyle></p><p>and the second number is: <code><bstyle>10</bstyle></code></p><n>```<n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>The following are four different representations of $1 ÷ 1.25$. Answer the multiple choice question<n>### Scenario: <n><n>The following scenario will be used in each exercise in this chapter.<n><n>####  A: Candy<n><n><n>**I**n the last episode, Misha gave a speech to the kids about the different animals he encountered on his visit. The kids were given a couple of questions asking them what they had learned. <n><n>The questions were: <n>I<n><n>What was a fun fact you learned about Misha’s trip? <n><n>Misha was able to teach us how some animals play with the water. <n><n>Who is the water rat? <n><n>The water rat is the most cute and adorable creature I’ve ever seen in my entire life. <n><n>Mishka is not the water rat, but someone else. <n><n>Most water animals have four toes on their front limbs and seven toes on their back limbs. <n><n>Because of the number of toes, the name of water rats are  water rats. <n><n>Why should we save the water rats? <n><n>Because this creature doesn’t have any natural predators, so as much as they don’t <n><n>We have to save them because they don’t have any natural  predators. <n><n>So we need to save the water rats. 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Where would you sit in a chair to watch four-legged animals complete? Choices:  A: bookstore B: house C: race track D: friend's house E: building<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### Choice E: <n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What could a balalaika be needed for? He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:The woman picked from an apple tree while surrounded by other trees, where was she? Choices:  A: illinois B: woods C: new york D: indiana E: farmer's market<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input 2: A woman had a baby at the age of 38. If the baby is 22 years old today what is the woman's age? Choices: 30 22 25 48 14<n><n>### Response 2:A<n><n>### Instructions:<n>You need to create a function that accepts text and replaces each of its punctuation marks with its uppercase variant.<n><n>### Response instructions 1:<n>**Example input and expected result:**<n><n>*input: "hello!?!?"<n>*expect: "HELLO!!"<n><n>*input: ",!?"<n>*expect:"!!"<n><n>#### Result:<n>```shell<n>function toUpper(x) {<n>  if (x=="")return x<n>  x=x.replace(/([+!~]+)/g," $1").toUpperCase()<n>  return x;<n>}<n>toUpper("Hello, how are you?")<n>```<n><n>### Instructios 2:<n>**Example input:**<n><n>*Input: "This is how I do it!"<n>*Expected result:<n><n>```shell<n>function ToUpper(x) { <n>   if (x=="") return x<n> x= x.replace(/([+,!~]+\s)+/g, " $1 ").toUpperCase()<n> x=x.replace(/\s/, "").toUpperCase() <n> return x <n>}<n><n>ToUpper("THis Is HuW i DoI")<n>```<n><n>#### Result: <n>```shell<n>function makeUpperCase(x) {<n>   if (x == "") return x<n>  //ToUpper case mark in a row<n>   let words= x.split(' ')<n>   for (let i = 0; i < words.length; i++) {<n>    words[i]= words[i].replace(/([+,+~])/g, " $&")<n>                    .toUpperCase();<n>   }<n>   return words.join(' ');<n>}<n>makeUpperCase("This Is How I Do It!")<n>```<n><n>This is the expected result<n>![expected result](https://github.com/saripatabhattarai/saripatapartabhattar

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What could contain no more than around 100 people? Choices:  A: apartment B: classroom C: buildings D: car E: audience<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n>A: apartment<n><n>### Input<n>July 2017:<n><n>A: 12.36 B: 4.29 C: 6.73 D: 2.75 E: 7.47<n><n>January 2018:<n><n>A:16.8 B: 7.71 C: 9.8 D: 4.72 E: 10.48<n><n>July 2318:<n><n>Answer: C)<n><n>### Task:<n>Please write a python response with a minimum of 600 characters.<n><n># Part Two(Requirement 2)<n>Complete the following exercise. Please write in python.<n><n>Input: A company has a 2.1% pay raises from last year.  Employees in different departments receive them at the same percentage.<n><n>First they receive a 4% raise regardless of their job title<n>Then they receive another 2.1% increase<n>Finaly they receive 40% of that additional increase<n>Rationales: Employees who are in a leadership position or executive titles, receive a 4% pay increase and are then given an increase of another 2.1%.  In the third part of the pay raise they receive a 40% increase (that was added to thier 4% and 2.1%) and the total pay increase is 65%.<n><n>Input: You are applying for a job and you were accepted at a small company as an accountant, the company is offering you $2.75 more an hour than you are currently making.<n><n>If the company is 20.47 square feet then:<n>- That would be $13.63 dollars ($13.63/20.47=<<13.63*20.47>>20.47) an hour<n>-$1.04 dollars per hour is added for benefits.  So total would be $14.67 an hour<n>If the company is less than 20.46 square feet then the calculation should be done in reverse of what was done above.<n><n>Your current job is 5.50% below the cost of living (as calculated by the government standard of living for your area)
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:In what place could you find air that has been breathed by only a few people recently? Choices:  A: train station B: house C: cupboard D: cricket stadium E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer the question based on the diagram.<n>###<n><n>### Answer:E<n><n>### Response description, part 2:<n>Input:Matthew wanted to make sure he had plenty of time before his flight was due to depart,  so before he left for the airport, he made sure to check to the arrival time on his flight.  Upon seeing the arrival time, it was 9 am.  Matthew checked the same  number on his phone, and while he was 5 minutes off  he still felt  like he had plenty of time.  What time should he  have arrived to the airport as estimated from his phone to  make sure he had a lot of time to get to his gate? Choices: 1. 7:55 am<n>2. 8:00 am<n>3. 8:03 am<n>4. 8:05 am<n>5. 8:10 am<n><n>### Answer 4<n><n>## Note:<n>1. Choices: A: Rome<n>B: Venice<n>C: Milan<n>D: Naples E: Florence<n><n>Response:<n><n>###<n><n><n>---<n><n>---<n><n># MultipleChoices<n>## Description of the task<n><n>* Multiple Questions: Select an answer in accordance with what is depicted.<n>* For all questions, the answer is in the question and you only need to pick which one is the answer.<n><n>### Input<n>> This is a 2d array and you need to pick one to be true and one to be false. He wouldn't meet him in the dinning room because the court decides on matters pertaining to the dinning room, thus, he would not go there to meet the ambassador. He would not meet the ambassedor on the throne room because the king is already on the throne room. If he would meet him on the monarchy, then he would be meeting the representatives, not the king.<n><n>#### 210<n>Answer: A<n><n><n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What is a place that might not always have a queen? Choices:  A: bee hive B: england C: castle D: deck of cards E: chess game<n><n>### Response:		The answer is 'C', a castle doesn't "always have a queen".<n>### Explanation: It is not 'E' because "there isn't always" in that case would be considered a falsehood.   You would not have "alway" in either 'A' or 'B'.<n>### Demonstatation:  A castle always has a queen because in most castles one exists.  For 'D' the word "always" and 'E' "always"<n><n>Input:<n>Write a function that takes an input number. It should return a greeting if the input number is even and a command if the number is odd.<n><n>Input A: the number is 22.<n>Rationales: the number is even if every factor of the number is even and '22' and '6.8' are both even.<n>The code should return: 'hello'<n>Input B: the number is 91.<n>Rationales:'91' is odd because the factors of '91' are 1, 3, 11, and 91 which are all odd numbers<n>The code should return an error command<n><n>#### Explanation: The number A is even because 1 and 6.8 are both even. B is odd because of how the factor '91' is odd.<n><n>#### Input:<n><n>```js<n>function myGreeting(num){<n>	if (num % 2 == 0)<n>		return "Hello"<n>	else <n>		return "Exit"<n>}<n>num = 22 // hello<n>num = 91 // Error command<n>```<n><n># Homework:<n><n>### Part I: Explanation of Algorithm<n>The algorithm we'll use is called a "bubble sort". It is an "in-place" sort, which means the data is stored within an array while sorting occurs. No new copies of the data are made. Sorting the data involves swapping adjacent elements. <n><n>Consider the array [5, 2, 3, 9, 4, 8].  Bubble sort begins at the far left position of the array and swaps adjacent values to move them towards their correct place. So, the first position will contain the highest value and the last position will contain the lowest value.<n><n>5 2 3

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What place is not interesting to children? Choices:  A: classroom B: toy store C: school D: soccer game E: dinner<n><n>### Response:		<n>In my opinion C is not an interesting place for children as compared to A, B, D and E. This means that for children C is the least  interesting  place whereas C is the last choice to be made from four different choices.This is because that in my opinion children usually love to visit their school because of the fun they are sure to get in school.I cannot see any situation in which children would be in love with school unlike A (the classroom) which children love to visit on a weekly basis for educational purposes.I would also choose option D( the soccer game) because it helps the players to develop the ability to run and walk on an unsteady ground without falling.The option A(classroom) is my second option.<n><n>### Input :  What subject is most likely to be taught at University?  Choices:1. Economics 2. Finance 3. Mathematics 4. Accounting.<n><n>### Solution<n><n>In my opinion choice C (the university) is not the right choice as compared to the other three choices because university is usually where you study after getting the basic education. In other words, university comes right after the secondary school or the high school where you study the basic education. This information is evident from the following diagram.<n><n>The diagram shows that from secondary high school, you proceed onto the university to further your education.<n><n>![](diagram3.jpg)<n><n>As such it is difficult to imagine the scenario in which the university is considered first among the four choices because the university is where you study after having completed your basic education.<n><n>The option C( the university) will be my second choice as compared to choices A (economics) B (Finance), and D (Accounting) because according to our constitution, higher education including universities is one of the key sectors of focus in the Tanzanian economy. Therefore it is my second selection as compared to the other options.<n><n><n>### Input<n>What is the least interesting city?<n><n>### Answer<n>The least interesting city is London as compared to other three cities because  the other most interesting cities to visit for a tourist are places which are associated with beautiful weather like Spain,Italy,Florida among others.  However, London is not a warm sunny destination all year around. London is known to be a cold, dark, and rainy place and this means
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:How can you get in shape if there is no land nearby? Choices:  A: swim B: jog C: excercise D: work out E: rock climb<n><n>### Response:		<n>C<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer the following multiple choice qustion.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>D stands for workouts.<n>You can get in shape by rock climbing.<n>Rather than "No land", is better to choose "There's no land nearby" to get the correct answer.<n>Otherwise, if you select "There is no land nearby" as an input, program will generate error: <n>```bash<n>4949494<n>```<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>Answer the multiple choice question by choosing the best option.<n><n>### Response<n>D<n><n>### Instructon:<n>Answer the question<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>Input 1: I want to get a haircut, which should I do: A: Go right and look for the shop on your left.  B: Walk to the other end of the street and turn left there.  C: Walk to the end the street, keep straight and you'll find the next street.  D: It doesn't matter.<n><n>### Analysis:<n>Input 1: It was given that walk to the other end of street and turn left there would not be a street near it, thus the only choice that we cannot find a street there would be "D: It doesn't mattr".<n><n>For Input 2, "D" is the only one that does not allow for the street to be turned.<n><n>### Input 1:<n>C<n><n>Input 2:<n>A<n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What are ai machines known for doing? You have to read, write and store data into the database. For the programming language that you are using, write a code that will use the following pseudo-code to show how to perform the task of reading, writing and storing data from the database.<n>Rationales: Write a user name and a password to access the database.<n>Connect to the DBMS<n>Create a table for the user<n>Fill this table with the user data(age, username, username etc)<n>Read the data<n>Store this data to the table<n><n>#### PPWPWPPWWPWWW<n><n>### Instution 4:<n><n>### Rationals:<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>### Output:<n><n>### Instucion 5:<n><n>### Answe:<n><n>#WPSHSS<n><n>### Instaction 6:<n><n>### Deostrations:<n>#WHQHQQJ<n><n>### RATIONALES:<n><n>\-H is how to do it<n>\-Q is about how you have tried to finish this task<n>\-J is about the challenges you will face<n>### Demosttations:<n>####HH<n>### Instuition 7:<n><n>### Tecnically correct

All meats carry a certain amount of the animal that is used to make the food. This protein causes allergic reactions in some people when they consume it.<n><n>### Input 2:You must complete each set of equations below. Choose your equation, and solve each set. Choose an equation, A, B, or C, and choose an answer, 1, 2, or 3, to each set. Each choice should be made in order from top to bottom.<n><n>Input 2:A: 12a - 8(a + b) = 42<n>B: 12(a + b) + 8a  = 72<n>C: 12a + 8b - 22 = 44<n><n>A: 12 * 12a - (8 * (a + b)) = 42<n><n>Therefore 12(12a - 4(a + b)) =42 <n><n>12(8 * 1 + 4 * 3) = 42 <n><n>80(1 + 4) = 42 which is 502 =  23<n><n>Answer: 23<n><n>B: 14(a + b) - 12a = 64<n><n>14(2 * 1) = 28<n>Answer:28<n><n>C: 24*a + 68 = 700<n><n>24 * 26 = 624<n>Answer: 26<n><n>### Input Three:Which of these statements is true? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:In the movie a fragile man is causing accidents, his hope is to find a person opposite of him who is what? Choices:  A: undestroyable B: unbreakable C: indestructible D: durable E: invisible<n><n>### Response:		<n> <n>```javascript<n>if(answer === "indestructible") {<n>  return "true"<n>} else if(answer === "unbreakable") {<n>  return false<n>} else if(argument === "invincible") {<n>  return true<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Rationale:In the movie a man is doing something wrong, and he is trying to find a perfect opposite.So if he dose everything right things will be good.<n><n>```<n>if(answer === ("indestructible " )) {<n>  return "You are indestructible."<n>} else if(ansaer === ("unbreakable " )) {<n><n>  return "You ar eunbreakable." <n>} else if (answer === ("invincible " )) {<n>   return "You ar invincible."<n>}<n>```<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:It was a vast complex, the launch pad was just one part of what? Choices:  A: movie B: cape kennedy C: space center D: military installation E: spaceship centre<n><n>### Response:		Space centre<n><n><details><summary>How to do it</summary><n><n>Solution: A<n><n>```python<n>x=solution(input=['A','B','C','D','E'])<n>print(x)<n>```<n></details><n><n>Rationales: I think that the word vast is used in the sentence because of the large size of the entire complex that is used for the launch pad<n>The prefix vast means extremely <n>So it refers to the large size of the whole complex. <n>The prefix cape means head that is where the head of the spaceship  should point towards <n>Also, the prefix Kenned is used to mention President Kennedy.<n><n><details><title>Solution</title><n>    <summary>Given that : Solution</summary><n>    <n>    <dl><n>		<dt>A</dt><n>		<dd>I think that the word vast in the sentence must refer to the largesize of the complex</dd><n><n>		<dt><b>B</b></dt><n>		<n>		<dd><b>Cape Kennedy</b>.</dd><n>      <n>        <dt"><b>C</b></dt>        <n><n>        <dd><b>Space centre</b>.</dd><br><n>      <n>        </dl><n><n></details><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:He wore the wrong shoes while walking all day, now he has what on his heels and toes? Choices:  A: exercise B: moving forward C: feet D: blisters E: locomotion<n><n>### Response:		The correct response is E, locomotion.<n><n>### Input<n>### Response<n>### Explanation<n>### Answer<n>### Question 5<n>### Explanatation<n>### Answer

How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Lindy was a senior.  He lived with his children because he didn't want to go where? Choices:  A: republican party B: old people's home C: office D: park E: high school or college<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: Lidly is a senior. He lives with his children because he wants to be around them.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>###### A<n>Choices: A: republican party<n><n>### Rationale::<P><n>For option A, the phrase he wants to be around means his children. But at which place is he going to be around his children?<n>I guess you mean with whom he wants to be around? I am pretty sure he want to go with his children.<n><n>###### D<n>Choices: D: park<n><n>### Racionales:<n>###### D<n>We already learned that he's a senior. Park refers to the children, not his children<n><n>### Rationell: <n>Choices: D - park<n><n>### Justification 1:<n>When we're kids, we used to go to the public park every Sunday. And we used to play with the other children.<n><n>### Justfication 2::<n>When we have children also, we have to go to the park to take care of the kids.<n><n>### Evaluation<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Input<n>Lily's caravan is 9 feet wide, 10 feet long and 7 feet tall.  How much space does it take?<n>Rationales::<p><n>I understand the sentence as follows: Her caravan is 9 ft wide and 10 ft long. Therefore, the entire length is 19 ft. So the space needed is 19x7 = 133 ft.<n><n>#### 133<n>Answer: 133<n><n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:The old barn was beyond repair, they had to destroy it before they could what a new one? Choices:  A: make B: raise C: entice D: build E: fix<n><n>### Response:		<n>### I would like A, I think it is the right answer<n><n>### I would not like A, I think B is right<n><n>### I do not know if B is right, but I want A<n>#### I do not know if A is right, but I do not want to see any of the rest of your choices listed<n>#### Please correct this by making it right and then changing it<n><n>#### This response is wrong<n>#### This response is right.<n><n>### Explanation: I think A is right, because there is an option B:<n><n>A: make B: raise<n><n>This is right, because I think the second option is building a new one<n><n>I do not know why A is wrong and the second option is not wrong<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:They wanted to eat at home but the cupboards were barren, so they had to go what? Choices:  A: cook dinner B: eat C: go back to work D: make food E: get food<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>If you have any question related to Coding or AI or ML, you can check the blog section of the blog or drop a comment in the comment section. Your opinions matter.

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What would you do if you have curiosity about something but cannot leave your house? A person is given item 2 if the previous person was given an item 3. If a person is finished with an item at the same time they receive an item, they wait until their next turn.<n><n>When the line reaches 9 people, how much time will it take for each person to get to the front of the line?<n><n>__[Rationales]:__If the line reaches 9 while there are 2 left then it will take one each turn, so 3 turns<n>If there were 3 left, then it would take one turn and one to wait until the end, totaling 2 turn<n><n>**Notes:** It should be 1 turn per person<n><n>__[Answer]:__ 45 minutes<n>
