He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Where do almost all people live? Choices:  A: football stadium B: apartment C: surface of earth D: car show E: house<n><n>### Response:		<n>B<n>Rationales: According to this website: [https://crudebirthrate.com/cities/india/](https://crude…)<n>The Crude Birth Rate in India last year was: 15/1000<n>Which means that 15 out of every 1000 people was born last year in India.<n>So according to this website, we can say that (on average) 15 million people were born last year.That means, over 137 million people were born last 10 years in India.<n>So over the 10 years, 137 million + 137 million = 2.7*108 people were born in India.<n>Which according to Google (the website) means that <n><n>1. over the 10 year period, there were a total of 2700 Million people born, and now (according to Pew Research) <n><n>2. there are a total of 7.6 Billion people around the world. This means that there are 5 billion people on Earth.<n><n>Given that, where do we all live? The answer is very simple. We live on Earth. (We live on the surface of it, not in a stadium or our parking lots)<n>We live everywhere: on the grass, the ground, the water and everywhere else that is not considered sky or above it.<n>Therefore, the only logical answer is A: the surface of earth.<n><n>#### 7<n>Answer: surface of earth<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What is another term for instituting civil action? Choices:  A: confusion B: complications C: riot D: arrest E: protests<n><n>### Response:		E<n>#### Protest<n>Answer: E<n><n>### Input Which of the following describes the structure of the US government? Choices:  [A]: federal system of government  [B]: unitary government  [C]: confederal government  [D]: constitutional monarchy  [E]: republican system<n><n>### Response [B]<n>#### Unitary government<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input What did the Magna Carta establish?  It ensured monarchs…(Choices)  [A]: would rule through the people  [B]: could enforce laws through the judiciary  [C]: were just and had a strong sense of duty  [D]: had a responsibility over the citizens  [E]: could not punish without trial<n><n>### Response E<n>#### monarchs could not punish without trials<n>Answer: E<n>### Input Which  method ensures that individuals follow their obligations? (Choices)  [ A]: Constitutional Republic [ B ]: Separation of Powers [C]: Rule of Law   [ D] Constitutional Monarchy   [E] Federalism<n><n>### Response B, C, D<n>#### Separation of powers and rule of law<n>Answer: B, C, D
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Where would I put a rosebush if I did not have any containers to store it in? Choices:  A: flower garden B: garden center C: pot D: pot E: formal garden<n><n>### Response:		 A<n><n>### Rational: 1st choose where we would not put it flower garden since we cannot put roses in a center since that is where we use roses<n><n>### Then choose the answer where we can put a rose which is pot<n><n>### Input : We have 12 bags of corn, 9 bags of rice, and 6 bags of oatmeal. We have enough to feed 20 people. Which ratio has the least value, and why?<n>### Rationales: To find out which would have the lowest value divide both numbers by the greatest number, therefore we can figure 12/10=<<12/10=.6>>0.6 and 6/10=<<6/10=.6 to see which is less than 0.6<n><n>### So the answer is rice the rice has the lowest ratio and that is true because no other ratio is less than 0..6<n><n>### The answer is rice<n><n>### Input Which number is larger? Choices:  a: 43 billion  b: 62 million  c: 27 million  d: 19 thousand e: <<<<6>>  f: <<<3>> g: <<<2>><n><n>### Rationale g since the numbers given are in order from smallest to greatest<n><n>### The Answer g<n><n>### What does 33+22+33 in order of their least to greatest mean?<n><n>### RATIONALES: first you must find a way to get to the greatest number<n><n>### so here we are adding in order because in order to get the greatest number we must add each number.<n><n>### So 33+23+23 equals: 36+56+56 which equals 148 which is the greatest number.

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Changing society using a violent conflict is know as a what? Choices:  A: action B: demonstration C: understanding D: vote E: revolution<n><n>### Response:		<n>This question requires you to pick the choice that is written in the correct answer. <n><n>#### E<n>#### E<n><n>### Input :You can calculate 2000^2 or 400^2 what is the difference between your result?<n><n>### Response :<n>This question requires you select the right answer.<n><n>#### 2100^2<n><n>### Input  :  It took two days to build the first pyramid.<n><n>### Response  :<n>This question requires to choose right choice.<n><n>####200 days<n>####200<n><n>### Instructions :How do you know if an input is valid?<n><n>#### Input:<n>Adam bought 3 kilogars of nuts and 1.5 kilogars of dried fruits<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### 57<n>Answer: 57<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>Analyze each data structure below, then answer the questions.<n><n>**Advantages of a Map<n><n>* Maps are unordered.<n>* Maps are stored as an array of key-value pairs.<n>* Maps don't have any capacity constraints.<n>* Because keys may be duplicate, Map can only store unique values.<n><n>**Adavantages of a Set<n><n>* Sets are unordered.<n><n>**Advanatges of a Stack<n><n>* Stacks don't have any duplicates.<n>* Stacks are unordered.<n>**Advantages<n><n>* Binary Search Tree has linear search time.<n>* Binary Search Tree is balanced.<n>* Binary Search Treemust be sorted before inserting and removing elements.<n><n>### Question 1<n><n>#### Which of the following is a better choice of data structure for a list of unique items:<n><n>* Map<n><n>#### Which of these data structures is more suited to handle unique items: Map or Set<n><n>#### Which of following data structure is better than the other for keeping track of a list of unique values:<n><n>Advantages<n><n>Adavantages<n><n>Advantages of a Stack<n>* Stacks don’t have any duplicates. * Stacks are unordered<n><n>#### Which of th following is better choice of data structure to keep track of unique items:<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What do humans take in while breathing? Choices:  A: lungs and diaphram B: oxygen C: abdominal muscles D: air E: open throat<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### 5

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. Choices:  A: boot B: the desert C: loaf of bread D: foot E: hock<n><n>### Response:		 You have to crack a loaf of bread into different pieces that have the shape of feet before you can use it in the kitchen<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>#### Input:<n><n>#### Output:<n><<4>>4<n><n>#### Comments:<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Complete the function.<n><n>### Problem Description:<n><n>The function has the return statement but the return value has not been specified.<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>Both of these returns are wrong.<n>The first one should be `42` and the second one should be `3`.<n><n>How do you know?<n><n>In the first function, the variable is declared as an undefined value. Then it's multiplied by 2 to result in `undefined*2`, which results in an error and has to be specified explicitly and converted to a number.<n><n>The second one is `return 4`, and has no way to be evaluated unless one explicitly converts it into a number.<n><n>#### Return from Part One:<n>`45`<n><n>#### Return from part Two:<n>`3`<n><n>#### Note:<n><n>The function will not be evaluated and returned unless you explicitly give a value.<n><n>#### Solution<n><n>```<n>let x = 4<n>try{<n>  return x + x<n>}<n>catch{<n>  console.log("The number was incorrect")<n>}<n>```<n><n><n>### Output:<n><n>#### Run One<n><n>It should output the number 46.<n><n>#### Run Two<n><n>It should output an incorrect number<n><n><n><n>### Democracy<n><n><n>### Task<n><n><n>#### Test-Driven Development (TDD)<n><n>##### Task 1 <n><n>* What is the definition of Test-Driven-Development (TDD)?  What does it offer a developer?<n>* How does TDD help prevent bugs in your codebases?  What are some common pitfalls that developers run into when developing with TDD?<n><n>##### Task2<n>* What is a unit test?  Show the output of what a unit test looks like in your IDE/console.<n>* A unit test is to a codebase as a smoke test is to a product.  What this mean?  Provide an example.<n>* Write a test that tests for a particular codepath.

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:John is a human who is in a wheelchair due to an accident. The correct answer is<n><n>#### E<n>Answer: E<n><n>#### 8<n><n>### Input:\[13,8](<n><n>The answer is<n><n>: <<13, 8)<n>>><n><<13, 8)=7<n><<7+ (8)>><n><n>#### 21<n><n><n>### Input:[4,3](<n><n>The answer should be <n><n>: <<<4, 3) >><n><<7+ (3)>><n><n>####87<n><n>### Input<n>[5,5,49,4](<n><n>The correct answer is<n><n>:  <<<5, 5, 49, 4)>><n><<<<7+(30)>>>><n><n>####221<n><n>### Input [1,6](<n><n>The answer <n><n>: <<<\(1, 6)>><<<n><<1*(18)>><n><n><n>#### 18<n><n>### Instructions:Input a list of two-element lists, for example [[13, 7], [8, 3]]. In Python, the operator + is an addition of two values. In this question, use the operator + to combine the two-element lists and display the numbers in a single two-element list. For example, the following input is interpreted as [[13, 0, 7, 0], [0, 8, 3, 0]]. What should the response be?<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>For the input [[13, 8] + [13, 5] + [8, 9]] we have<n><n>\[ [13, 8 + 13, 5], [13, 0 + 8, 9] \]<n><n>We can now simply add all of the lists and that will give us<n><n>\[ [26, 18] \]<n><n>The final input that we will give is<n><n>\[(13, 8, 13, 0) + (13, 5, 8, 9)\]<n><n>If we again think of the different lists in terms of the above rationale we get<n><n>\[

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Where are a lot of offices in New York? Choices:  A: school building B: skyscraper C: business D: grocery store. E: work<n><n>### Response:		A: school building (school building)<n><n>### Input:"What is the weight of the apple I just ate?"<n><n>### Response:"My favorite color is green."<n><n>### Question:What is the weight of your favorite color?<n><n>### Explanation: You're going on to the next question when you answer my query with the keyword "color".<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Explanation:Answer the following multiple answer question.<n><n>## Instructions:Answer one multiple choice question.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:He would finally see idea become reality, never in a million years did he what that this would happen? Choices:  A: think B: patent C: determined D: work hard E: relax<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Explanatory response<n>### My solution<n>Input:He would finally see his idea become reality, but never in a million years would he think that this would happen. <n>Rationales: the answer is B because it sounds good and makes the right sense<n>#### B<n><n>### Input<n>Choice:<n>Based on your answer to Problem 2, what is the value of “x” in the expression 2x1=3x3=4x72x1=3×3=4×7<n>Answer: 8<n>#### B<n>### Explanation:<n><n>I did the question based on the answer to the question 2, but it is not entirely correct.<n><n>In the Question 2 I put the first one at value 3 because the 2 should be greater than 1, and in addition the 1 should be greater than the 3, so the total of the first one is 4 and not 3. As for the second one, i assumed that “3” should be in the 10 and 7 should be in the 2, this makes the first one 4 and the second one 5. As for the last, i assumed that “4” should be in the first one and the “7” in the second. This makes the first expression to be 5, the second one 7, and the last one 12. So the correct answer should be 075.<n><n>So the final answer should be:<n>(2x1)= 5(3x3)= 075<n>and not:<n>(2x3)= 8<n>### Solution:<n>Problem 3<n>1) I chose 3 because my answer in the previous problem<n>Because 2+4+6+8+10+12+14+................... was my answer to the previous problem, so after solving it I got 2+4+<<.......>> = A for the first answer and for the second 3+6+.......+12 +...=B.<n><n>2)  My answer was 14<n>I just choose 2+something and 3+something until the got 14. Since i got nothing I choose 2+4, then I did this and after getting 6, I chose 3+6 and after getting 9 I chose 4+
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What is a negative effect to someone other than a spouse when two spouses are getting divorced? Choices:  A: lot of grief B: depression C: no spouse D: lose money E: children suffer<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### A: lot of grif <n><n>### Instructions:Write an appropriate response. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:James looked for a pencil sharpener.  Where might he look first? Choices:  A: cabinet B: library C: nightstand D: stationery store E: desk drawer<n><n>### Response:		Input:James could look at<n>a: The Cabinet<n>b: The nightstand<n><n>c: The Stationary store<n><n>d: The Drawer of his desk<n><n>### Rationales: <n><n>Input:James can look at  the cabinet(A), the night stand(B), the Stationary Store(C) and the Drawer of his deskm(d)<n><n>#### 1<n>Answer: d<n><n>Input:Matthew brought 6 apples from the farmer's stand. He divided it equally between himself and two of his friends and ate one himself. How many apples does each of Matthew's friends get?<n><n>Input:<n>Matthew's friend(f) get: <n><n>Inputs:<n><n>Matthew and his two friends(f)<n><n>Input:He brought it equally to two friends and himself.<n><n>Matthew took(<<=1>>1)1 apple<n>Matthew gave(<<=1>>2)2 apples to his friends<n>Matthew friends (total) got (<<=1>>1+<<=2>>2)3 apples<n>While Matthews still has one apple left<n><n>So each of Matthews Friend(f) got =1 apple + 2 apples(<<=1>>3)3 apples<n><n>1 + 2 = 3<n><n>3+1 = 10<n><n>3+10 = 13<n><n><n>#### 13<n>Answer: 13<n><n>Input:Ethan bought 3.5 ounces of  oranges at the fruit store. How much oranges does he get?<n><n>input:<n>4.0 ounces(<<=4> ounces(<< 4> ounces)0)8ounces of orange<n><n>Input:Ethans bought :  Ethans bought 3.5 oranges<n>Ethans Buy :  ((3. 5)*<< 4> ounce)4<< 1>ounce>8<n><n>Ethans bought 8,4ounces of orange<n>Eethan bought 8,4 ounces of orange<n>While there are >><<=1*1=1>>1*1=1 oranges in every ounce<n><n>So 8*(1 * 1)<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:James is very interested in other planets.  He loved the idea of going to mars, and reads books about it all the time.   He dreams of being on what? Choices:  A: love B: zoo C: school D: space shuttle E: library<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input : I like to travel, because I have enjoyed exploring new places.<n>### Response: <n><n>### Input  : I want to try this<n>### Response<n><n>### Input<n>Adam owns 3 t-shirts and 2 pants. He wants to have every day of the week a different combination of these items of clothing. How many possible combinations are there?<n><n>### Response <n><n>### Instructions  The following word problem describes a task that requires you to write one full English sentence.<n>### I have $60 for a new computer. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:James was looking for a place to buy bitcoins.  He searched and found a large menu of what? Choices:  A: advertisement B: news C: bar D: cafe E: internet sites<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Answer:  A<n>Answer:<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>### Input<n>The answer choices for the questions are displayed in the image.<n><n>### Response<n>Write a response that appropriately fills in the correct answer.  Your response should include a line with  or  and your answer on a new line.<n><n>### Demo<n>Input: Johns has a hammer and a nail for $3.  He has a screw for $2.  How much does he have for working?<n>Rationales<n>First, Johns buys the screw $2 = <<2=2>>2 He has it.<n>Then he buys the hammer and a nails for $3 = <<3=3>>3 He does not have it.<n>Johns loses a total of $3 = <<3 = 6>>3 from his total of $6 = <<6 = 6>>6 He has 4 left in working funds.<n>#### 4<n>Input:  How much is 239 pounds in kilograms? Rationales: The answer is 239/<n>Answer: 11.4791

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. Choices:  A: get angry B: concern C: worrie D: education E: learning about world<n><n>### Response:		<n>Rationales: A: get angry is an incorrect answer because it will not answer the question. While reading a newspaper you are not likely to get angry.<n>B: concern, D: education, E: learning about world are all incorrect because you are not learning about these when you are reading a newspaper.  You are only learning about local current events when you read a newspaper, not world events.<n>C: worrie is an incorrect answer because you are not worried when you read a newspaper.<n><n>CORRECT ANSWER:<n>### CORRECT ANSWERS:<n>A)E

LCM (27, 40) = 120 <n>Less common than 30, so lesser choice is 30 <n><n>### Input 3:<n><n>### Expected Answer/Choice 3:<n><n>#### 120<n>### Rationale :LCM (39, 56) = 126 <n><n>### Instructuion:Answer  the remaining multiple choice questions.<n><n>### Expectable answer 4:<n><n>### More choices for 4:<n><n>#### 228<n>Answer: 228<n><n>### Ruturally, it is expected that the answer will be 234, but actually the answer is 228, so it means that the answer choice is not the least Common multiple of the two numbers.<n><n>### More answers for Choice 4:<n><n><n>#### 30840<n>Answer: 30841<n><n>### Instuction:Answer Question 5<n><n>### Explanation  Question 5:<n><n>### Insturction:<n>If there are more answers to these questions, do you choose the choice with the least common multiple?<n><n>### Excerpt:<n><n>#### 7060020<n>Answer: 7060100<n><n>### Insturation:<n>If there are less answers than Question 5, what should you choose?<n><n>### Ratiation:<n>#### 67890<n>Answer: 67910<n><n>### Excepting Answer<n><n>### Excpect Answer<n><n>### Insturaction:<n>Answer Question 7.<n><n>### Ration:<n>#### 17<n>Answer: 18<n><n>### Mental Reasoning<n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:He found the blowfish off the coast of the Carolina's, it was where? Choices:  A: rock band B: sea of japan C: sushi restaurant D: fish market E: atlantic ocean<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: rock band B: sushi restaurant C: sea of japan D: fish market E atlantic ocean <n><n>### Input :<n>B: sushi restaurant<n><n>Rationale: B is the closest to "Carolina's"<n><n>### Response :<n>B: sashimi and sushi, they are a japanese meal<n><n>### Input <n><n>#### 1.<n>A: rock band<n><n>#### 2.<n>B: fish market<n><n>#### 3.<n>E: atlantic ocean.<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### 1:<n>A is the furthest from "Carolina'a" <n><n>#### 2:<n>B: Fish Market<n>A fish market sells fish and fish related items, that could be the answer, but it sounds like a general "farmers market"<n><n>#### 3:<n>E is the closest to "atlantic ocean"<n><n>### Answer<n><n>#### A<n>1<n>A<n>#### B<n>#### B<n>1<n>The closest to "Carolinas" is B, this is due to the fact Carolina is located in a different state than the other three.<n><n>#### E<n>3<n>E<n><n><n><n><n><n>### 3.<n><n>Input: What is the area of this quadrilateral? Choices: 1: rectangle   2: trapezoid 3: square 4: circle<n><n>Rationale: All of these choices have one or more sides that is not straight. <n><n>#### 3<n>Answer: 1<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: If a person walks 30 inches in eight minutes how many inches will the person walk if the walk lasts ten minutes? Choices:<n>1:58.33334*7/30,<n>2:58.34486*7/30<n>3:68.3324<n>4:68.3236<n><n>Answer:3<n><n>### Input;<n><n>Input:<n>What is 150 as a percent of 20. Choices: 150: < 20, 150>20,  150>2, 150<20<n><n>Rationale:150
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What area is likely to contain a large village? Choices:  A: rural area B: big city C: suburbs D: ohio E: countryside<n><n>### Response:		B<n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input How does the following program work?<n><n>### Response The program gets a 4 digit number and multiplies each element of the 4 digit number by 5. In other words, the program does the following equation. A 4 digit number, say 1234 is multiplied by 5, giving a 5 digit result, say 12,340 and that result is displayed on the screen. The program then deletes the 4 digit result and starts the process again.<n><n>#### 1234<n>Answer: 12,3,40<n>#### 12,3340<n>Answer: 11240<n>#### 2134<n>Answer:2662<n>#### 12134<n><n>Answer:15672<n>#### 2123<n><n>Answer:3022<n>#### 	1232<n><n>Answer:4788<n>#### 2312<n><n>Answer:5620<n>#### 3212<n><n>Answer:(1/6)(3/5)<n><n>#### (1,2,3,4,5)<n>Answer:210<n><n><n>### Input What is the sum of the two numbers? Choices: 35<n>C: 75<n>D: 95<n>E: 105<n><n>Response: B<n>#### E<n>Answer:105<n><n><n><n><n>### Instructions:Use the provided code to modify the greeting shown below.The string must still say “Happy holidays” when run without modification.<n><n>Input:  A Happy holidays to everyone!!!<n><n>Response: A Happy holidays!!!<n><n><n>###Instructions:The following code adds two decimal numbers. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week. Choices:  A: suface of moon B: building C: bridge D: ground E: bright light<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input, Demonstration, and Answer Description<n>Because a shadow forms only when there is some type of light source and a blocking object (ex: a building), the correct answer is "the ground".<n>

How did he do so? Choices:  A: hiding B: accidentally C: expectation D: knowingly E: planned<n><n>### Response:		<n>If George knowingly ruined the surprise that means he ruined it on purpose.<n>So George doesn’t knowingly ruin the surprise he has to do it unknowingly<n><n>Rationales: If George accidentally ruined the surprise he either intended to ruin it or didnt but ruined it unintentionally.<n><n>However if George accidentally ruined it and ruined it unintintentionally George has accidentally ruined the suprise<n><n>If George intentionally ruined it he did so on purpose.<n><n>If George knowingly intentionally ruined it then he intentially ruined the surprise<n><n>If George ruined it unintionally he also ruined it intentionally<n><n>If George ruins it intentionally but accidentally ruined it.  George ruins both the expectation and the surprise at the same time.<n><n>So if George ruined the surprise and ruined it on purpose George ruined the surprise on purpose<n><n>So if George knowingly ruined it he intentionally ruined the surprise.<n>That is he ruined it intentionally on a purpose which makes him knowingly ruin the suprise<n><n>#### <n>Answer:<n>>If George knowingly ruins it on a purpose he ruins the suprise on a purpose because he ruined it on a purpose knowingly<n>>If George ruins it unintentionally he ruined it intentionallly because he ruined it knowingly<n>>So George knowingly ruined is by ruining it intentionally on purpose<n>>If George ruined it on purpose he ruined the surprise intentionally<n>>So he did so on a purpose and he ruined it on that purpose<n>>If he ruined it on another purpose he ruined it intentionnally unknowingly<n>>Even if he ruined it intentionnalily and ruined it on an unknowing purpose he did so on a unknowing purpose<n>>If George does so his knows he ruined it on an unwillingful purpose<n>>All in all he does so knowingly<n><n>## 4.15. Write a program that answers the question(s) using Python.<n><n>### C:\Users\Evets\Document><n><n>```<n>How many hours did Tom spend training for the marathon?<n>He spent 2 hours a day in the week he studied, 4 hours total.<n>Then, he ate 7 sandwiches from Tuesday to Saturday each day.<n>He also ran 3 miles a day, then 6 miles on Saturday.<n>He added the total number of hours he spent training <n>in the week he studied (2 hours) and the total number <n>of sandwiches he ate from Tuesday to Sat. <n>Then found the total number of miles he ran during the week he studied by adding <n>the total number of miles he run in the week he studied (3 miles) + <n>the number of miles he ran on Saturday.  <n>The total number of hours he spend training (2 hours + 4 hours) <n>plus the number of miles he ran total (6 miles + 3 miles).<n>```<n>#### 50 hours<n>Answer: 50 hours.<n><n>#### (200)<n>Answer: 200.<n><n>### Question 3:<n><n>### Input\Output:<n><n>### Instructions:Write an instruction that describes the task, and then a response that appropriately answers the question.<n><n>## Instructions:  <n>How many days can Dude live off the 3 dozen jelly breads, 2 dozen dried mangoes, and 36 cans of corn he bought?<n><n>### Rationales:   <n>241<n><n>### Answer:<n>241<n>### Instrucions:The instructions below describe a mathematical problem. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:She a deep love for all her friends, every Friday she had an open invitation for them as she loved to host and what? Choices:  A: wait for B: eat out C: entertain D: please parents E: paint<n><n>### Response:		<n>She cooks food for all of her friends.<n><n>Input:  How many times will she invite? Choices: A: six  B: one  C: three  D: 2  E: zero<n><n>Response:  Answer:  E<n><n>Input: Which one is correct? Choices: A) 45 + 30 B) 30 *4  C) 30 + 30 D) 30 +30  E) 45+30<n>Response:  Answer : B<n>Answer: D<n>Answer: E<n><n>Input: What is half of 12?  Choices A: 6  B:11  C: 10.2  D: 6.2  E: 10.65<n>Response: Answer: C<n><n>Input: Which is the biggest integer? A: 350  B: 252 C: 175  D: 220  E: 173<n>Response: B and C<n><n>#### 350<n>Answer: 350<n><n>#### 220<n>Answer: 220<n><n>```<n>A: 220 B: 350 C: 173 D: 175 E: 252<n>```<n><n>```<n>A -> 220 B -> 350 C -> 173 D -> 175 E -> 252<n><n>A-> 173 B-> 175 C-> 252 D-> 220 E-> 350<n>```<n><n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:The circus monkey waived a white surrender flag, the conductor joked the monkey must work in the what? Choices:  A: french government B: friend's house C: zoo D: south africa E: madagascar<n><n>### Response:		<n>The monkey worked in the zoo.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>For the circus the monkey works in the zoo.<n>

One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week. Choices:  A: curiosity B: excitement C: boredom D: wonder E: fear<n><n>### Response:		Selecting the correct response to the instruction.<n><n>### Rationale:  What feeling does a person most often have when new things are introduced to their life?  This is a tough question to answer without thinking too long.<n><n>### How to answer:  The A, B, C, D, or E is usually the best answer to this kind of question.  Since the question is looking for the person, A is not the correct answer.  Therefore, B, C, and D does not fit the answer.  So E is most likely the correct answer because a person is usually scared of new things.<n>

Choices:  All body parts A: penis B: stomach C: fingers <n><n>### Response<n><n>The penis is located between the legs.<n><n>---<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write a response that appropriately replies to this conversation. Be sure to reply to the questions in the same order they were given to you by your instructor.<n><n>### Demo:<n>Conversation:<n><n>---You: What are these bones made of?<n><n>|Bone|Choices|answer|<n>|:---:|:---:|:--:|<n>|shoulder blade|A: steel B: fiberglass C: hamburgers|  <n>---<n><n>---You: These bones are metal.<n><n>### Rationale for conversation:<n>Bone is solid, dense  and hard.  Bones are made of different types of tissues, including collagen. Collagen gives bones strength and durability. Bones have nerves, blood and minerals. Bone is so tough because its chemical composition is made up of hydroxyapatite. The minerals calcium and phosphate make up hydroxyapatite, which is what bone is mainly made of. A bones weight depends on its size.  Bones serve as support.  <n><n><n>### Answer:<n>Bone is made of calcium phosphate, which is composed of calcium carbonate, hydroxyapatite, and free crystallized calcium.<n><n>---<n>1. 4 hours ago<n>You: I am so busy!<n><n>|Choices|Answer|<n>|:---|:---|<n>|A: Are you busy enough?	|I am so busy!.|<n>---<n>1.1 hours ago<n>You: Want to go out for dinner?<n><n>1.2 hours ago<n>You: Sounds like a plan! He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:If you hit someone while driving what could happen to that person? Choices:  A: deaths B: get arrested C: moving D: using gas E: may die<n><n>### Response:		Deaths<n>#### Deaths  A:  deaths  B:  may die  E:  get arrested A: may die  C: using gas  D: arrested<n>#### 14<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Instructions: The students on the cheerleading team are in the hallway waiting for a game. They are in line waiting for the hallway monitor to go off work. They can’t be in a straight line as they are very chatty. There are four (4) hallways they can enter. The hallways have four cheerleaders each. They cannot leave until they have formed a straight line. If it is too crowded they cannot enter the hallway.<n><n>How should the students line up and leave their group?<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Response<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:You'd add pepper and salt to what liquid meal if it's bland? (can''t remember)<n>### Input:<n>What''s the difference in price? Choices:<n>A: 12 dollars C: 37 dollars B: 24 dollars <n>D: 44 dollars<n>Both A, B and C are correct. There''s different prices for the 4 of the shirts. There''s $14 for the green shirt, $16 for 2 of the shirts which are red and pink, $20 for the other green shirt, and $25 for the blue shirt. The red, pink, green 3, and the blue shirts which are in the last set have different prices. $12 - $14 = <-2--> - <-14--> = <-2-14=2><n>If the green shirt was $14, then the other 2 would be $10 and $16. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:James was a student who had a report that is due tomorrow.  Where might he spend most of his time today? Choices:  A: university B: college class C: class room D: classroom E: library<n><n>### Response:		In order to understand question I need more information, like what is James doing and why.  I also need to understand this concept of a "report." I would like more information about an "on time essay." I would assume it will take James until tonight to finish his report for tomorrow, so he should spend his last day at the library, where he will have the best chance of finishing the essay.<n><n>### Context:<n>A report is a form of written communication for the express purpose of providing written information to others for a specific purpose, intention or object. In the world of business, reports are used to inform management of the performance of their employees. In the academic world, reports are used by students and teachers to help a student to pass an academic course.<n><n>### Input/Output:<n>Input: Adam went over 4 miles one way today.<n>Output:  I do not need to know more.  I know what Adam did, and I know that going over 4 miles one day is a very short trip for a vehicle.  I know nothing of Adam, his vehicle, what else he did that day, or where he went.  How do you think Adam would feel if he went this far?<n>Input: John wants to learn Spanish from Roselyn so he could travel abroad with her.  How should John approach this task? Choices A:  he could take some online Spanish courses B: he could read a Spanish newspaper everyday C: he could watch Spanish news<n><n>### Response/Output:<n>Input/Output:<n>Input 1: Adam bought 35 kilograms of fruits at a grocery store and spent $15 to get there today. The cost of each fruit is $0.90.<n>Output:<n>Adam's trip cost $35+$15=$50<n>If Adam bought 40 kg of fruits, Adam would have spent $35+$17.50=$52.50<n>I do not need to know anything else; I know that the cheaper the fruit the less expensive the trip.<n><n>### Rationales and Explanation:<n>Input:  How do you think it is possible a student can get an As and Bs?<n><n>### Context/Rationale:<n>A grade (letter grade or percentage grade) assigned to assess a student regarding his/her knowledge, skill and ability.

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What is a fast but expensive way to send small cargo? Choices:  A: airplane B: ship's hold C: boat D: truck E: train<n><n>### Response:		E<n>#### <n>Answer: E<n><n>### Input, part 2:What is quick but very inefficient way to send small cargo E: truck F: train G: boat H: airplane I: ship's hold<n>#### <n>Answer (part 2): E<n><n>### Part 3<n>Input:The total weight of the cargo that Adam and Johns bought is 7.2 kilograms. How much dried fruits did Johns buy? <br>Demonstration: 7.2/2.5=<<7.2/20=3.0>>3.0 kilograms<n>#### <n>Answer 3.0<n>#### part 3<n>Answer 3.5<n>   <n><n>### Part four<n>Input:  Adam spent 246 dollars and 45 cents at the store. Johns spent 153 dollars 53 cents on his purchases. How much more did Johns spend then Adam? <br><n><n>Demonstration: Johns spent 1 dollar and 50 cents more.<n>Rationale: The difference between two positive numbers is always positive.<n>####<n>Answer: 1<n>####<n><n>### Part Five<n>Input:  What did Johns spend on food?  Choices:  P: 153.53 D: 153 E: 143 F: 26.87 G: 23.58 H: 40.23 I: 153<n>####<n>Answer: J<n><n>### Part six<n><n>Input:<n>I and J, are the numbers which is between <<48>>152 and <<67>>189<n>####<n>Answer: I<n>####<n><n>## Conclusion<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What is a useful activity when experiencing loneliness? Choices:  A: meet people B: meet friend C: make people laugh D: socialize E: liquor<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>|     |   |<n>|  A |  B |<n>|  C | E |<n>|  D |  F |<n><n>C<n><n>#### E<n><n>Answer:<n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day. There are 60 degrees in one degree so there should be 60/40 = <<60/40=1.5>>1.5 degrees in two.<n>Fraction is equal to 1.5/1 = <<1.5/1=1>>1. Then, the number of apples should be 1 because every degree is equal to an apple.<n>#### 1<n>Answer: 1<n><n>### Input 1:<n>This task is based on a set of three questions.<n><n>### Response 1:<n>If the numbers 0-3 have been divided, give the remainder, or 0 if none is produced. Your icecream costs $7 and your sisters icecream costs $6. How much does the icecream cost?<n>Rational: You buy 1 ice-cream @ $7 = $<<7>><n><n>Your sister buys 1 ice-creams @ $6 = $<<6>><n><n>So we spend @$6+$<<$7>>+5=$<$6+$<<$6>>$7>>$6+$<<$3>>$7>>$4>>+$<<$4>>=$5+3=$<<5+3=$8>><n><n>---<n><n>Instructions (A): Which of the following statements concerning polynomials is false?<n><n>Instruction (B): A=(-3x-2)(4x+5)<n><n>Instructs (C): P(x) = (x-3)2-2<n><n>Instructions: Write a sentence that shows that at least two of the statements above are true.<n><n>---<n><n>### Instrection: Which of the following is a divisor of (26^5)(70^3)<n><n>Instruction (1): 26^5 = <<26^5=2536>>2536

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:John spent too much money buying products for his swollen testicles.  He did so because he was feeling what? Choices:  A: pleasure B: delight C: bankruptcy D: agony E: owning<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Demolition:<n>Input:John spent too much $$$money buying products for his testicles.  He was so happy that he spent $money because he felt _____.<n>Rationales: John felt ____<n>#### 1<n>Answer: 1<n>#### 1<n><n>### How did John change the sentence?<n><n>### Answer:<n>John spent too much money on buying products for his _________.  He spent the money because he felt _______.<n>Rationales: <n>#### 1<n>John felt bankruptcy since his testicle became bigger. So he decided to  buy products for it because he wanted to make it smaller. <n>He ____ a lot of money on the products because he really wanted his testicles less bigger. But he ended up with bankruptcy. <n>#### 3<n>John spent too much on buying products for ______. He spent that ______ because he felt ______.<n>Rationales: $Based off of the 3rd example answer I decided to change too because it's a verb. Instead, I went with buying products because that is something that is owned. I changed too much because it does not make sense and it isn't how he really felt. I knew that he felt bankrupt so I used so because I don't know the exact amount that he spent so I am not going to be specific with it, so I put so. For example John spent so much money on products for his testicles bankruptcy hit him.<n>#### 2<n>I ___ a lot of money on products for my testicles... But because I did that I caused my bankruptcy...<n>Rationales: I bought the products because I wanted my testicles to be less big (they got pretty big) and the thought that came to my head that I bought the products I did was too much money.<n>#### 4<n>I _____ a lot of money on testicle products... Because I did that...<n>Rationales  I bought the wrong products because I wanted them to be less big than how they were. I bought lots of lotions and other things for my testicles,  I ____ a lot of cash for those pills.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What do people look for when competing against someone? Choices:  A: edge B: desire to win C: friendship D: rivalry E: skill<n><n>### Response:		I would say they look for Edge<n><n>### Response Rationale:<n><n>### Instructions:In this task, you will need to answer the following multiple choice question that compares 2 pictures<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>Input: Compared to a typical modern house, what is one of few things that is the same? Choices: 1. roof 2. floor 3. walls 4. pillows <n><n>### Response and rationale:The only thing I see identical is the floor of both photos.<n><n>### Response rationale:<n>#### Answer:1<n>Answer: 1<n><n>### Instutions:<n>In this task, you're going to demonstrate the correct usage for the assignment statement.<n><n>Input: var y=15-4; var z=13-5; <n><n>Input: let m=1/5; <n><n>### Assignment Rationale:<n><n>In this task, You will be asked to complete a sentence that describes the syntax of the statement.<n><n>Input:"Money does not equal happiness".<n>### Response:As the statement indicates, the relationship between these 2 concepts can not be determined.<n><n><n><n>Input: m="The car is red"<n>Output: The car is red<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Three quarters of what are covered by the ocean? Choices:  A: waterfalls B: underwater C: beach D: surface of earth E: river<n><n>### Response:		<n>3/4=<<3/4=75%>>75% is covered by ocean.Covered by the ocean= 3/4 of A,B,C,D,E<n>So D is correct<n>#### D<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Input/Question:Three quarters of which area is covered by the ocean?<n><n>### Response/Answer(Either of the choices below can work):<n>3/4=70%<n>A : 3/4*A=<<3/4*A>12.78%<n>B : 3/4 * B=<<3/4 * B>12.7%<n>C : 3/4 C=<<3/4 C>25%<n>D : 3/4 D=<<3/4 D>75%<n>E : 3/4 E=<<3/4 E>50%<n>```<n><center><img src="https://img.shields.io/pypi/pyversions/python-code.svg"></center><n>```<n><n><n><n>### Instructions: In the following prompts, fill in the blank with the correct answer to the question.<n><n><center><img width=410px src="https://img1.wsimg.com/blobby/go/6c262a6e0da0cb5f8963aa6c33e16296/img/5f17d59735d15fe0972693c93cc07237/Powertest%20200.png" /><n></center><n><n>- One quarter of which area is covered be the ocean? Choices(A-E):<n>```<n>1/4*E=<<1/4*E>25%<n>1/4*C=<<1/4 *C>25%<n>```<n><n>- 75% of what are covered by Ocean<n>```<n>3/4A=<<3/2*A>12~13%<n>```<n><n>#### Answer: <n>```<n> 3/4A=25<n> 3/4 B=25<n> 75 %<n>```<n><n>### Instructon/Question:

Choices: 975 m A: short B: medium C: long D: very long<n><n>### Why the answer is B?<n>What is the length a typical road?<n>There are three categories: short, medium, and long<n><n><n>### Input - Question: A train can run on both 4 foot and 6 foot track. How many of these different tracks will a passenger traveling by train across the country, and not connecting anywhere, pass through? A: 13 B: 56 C: 32 D: 8<n><n>### Rationales - In order to answer this question, it is important to understand the definition of both six -footer and four- foot track. A foot is a unit of length. A foot is equal to 12 inches or 0.3048 meters.<n><n>4 feet is equal to 0.483 meters<n><n>6 feet is equal to 1.2208 meters.<n><n>Therefore, 6 feet is greater in length than 4 feet.<n><n>### Answer - 56, there are two sets of tracks for every one set of six- foot track.<n><n>### Input the answer: A train can travel on 4 foot and 56 foot track? How many times does a passenger traveling by a freight train pass through the same set of tracks? Choices: A: none B: 1 time C: 4 times D: 6 times E: 24 times<n><n>### Rationale - Why 4 times - There are 16 eight track and eight is a factor of 16, there is 4 times.<n><n>### Rative - E - There are 56 tracks.<n><n>### Add up the answers to get the Answer<n><n>### Why does the answer equal 24 times?<n><n>### In order to answer this questions, one must understand the number of eight tracks and four -foot ties.<n><n>For each track on the railway train, there are

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What does a judge do when someone is convicted of a crime? Choices:  A: conduct trial B: arrest C: bring in verdict D: pass sentence E: serve justice<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>### Rationales: A judge makes decisions in court<n><n>### Input Explanation:<n><n>## Input: <n><n>Input: An airplane has 300 passengers. How many flight attendents does it have?<n><n>## Demonstration: <n><n>### Input Description: <n><n>300 passengers need 100 flight attendents to accompany.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>300 / (100 / 3) = <<300/100/3=100>>100 flight attendants<n><n><n>### Explanation:<n>An airplane has 3 passenger cabin, one hundred passengers in each section, so 300 flight attendents.<n>100 * 3 = <<100*3=300>>300<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:What would humans do when their legs are tired? Choices:  A: sit down B: make mistakes C: have sex D: reproduce E: excrete<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### D<n>##### Rationales:<n>##### E<n><n>#### Answer:<n>##### D<n><n>### Instructions:<n>1. Write a letter that appropriately completes each request.  <n><n>2. Write the number of the correct answer, and then write its explanation.<n><n>### Request:<n>Cars parked on the wrong side of the streets sometimes cause traffic. Make sure to park on the right side of the street and help the police to keep roads safe.<n><n>### Solution:<n>![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/60596471/145942555-8aac19f5-b516-42fe-b408-1539c0a396d7.jpeg)<n><n>- 3<n>- Car parked on the wrong (left to right) side of the street causes traffic jams<n><n>Cars parked under trees sometimes cause pollution. Make sure to park well away from trees during your stay, so we can keep our environment clean<n><n>- 3 (see)<n>- See the sign that says not to park under trees(see picture)<n><n>- 4<n>- If the car is parked under the tree, its pollution(hazardous substance) spreads on the tree, ground and people in the area. To avoid this situation, please park the car a bit farther from the tree. This will help keep the environment clean.<n><n>### Question:<n>1. A student asks, "Why is my math a hard subject?" Your friend says, "You have a hard time understanding why math is interesting." What response should you give?<n>2. A teacher asks, "Do you understand the purpose of the assignment?" Your friend says,  " I really need to do this assignment well." What does you friend mean?<n>3. A student says, "I am not good at English." What should you say?<n><n>### 1. Answer:<n>1.<n><n>> A: I am bad at Math<n><n><n>2.<n><n>> B: You do it as good as you can. If you keep on trying and you will do better at it<n><n>> C: You can do this<n><n><n>3. (See)<n><n>> C: I didn't
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Where is disease often spread but shouldn't be? Choices:  A: ghost town B: third world country C: human body D: rug E: hospital<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>

B:<n>C:<n>D:<n>E: Answer:<n><n>### Answer:<n>None of the above<n><n>### Commentary<n>The moon is in retrograde<n>The moon is in orbit<n>The moon is in eclipse<n>The moon is in 2nd quarter<n>The moon is in Libra<n><n>### Input where is a monkey?<n><n>A. In the trees b. In the streets c. In Africa d. In space<n><n>### Answer <n><n>None of the above.<n><n>### Comment<n>Monkeys are only found in the forests<n>They are also found in India<n><n>### Input answer the following<n>Monkey does not reside in trees it resides in bungaloes<n><n>### Task to solve<n>Where does a monkey reside?<n><n>### Answer<n>Bungalow and trees<n><n>### Comment justification<n>Monkeys don't live in bungalows, so bungalows is wrong<n>They do live in trees<n><n>### Input Where is a shark likely to reside? (Choices: a: Pacific Ocean b: tropics c: nightmare d: Wyoming e: bungalows)<n>bungalows<n><n>### Answer sharks don't reside in bungalows they reside in water <n><n>### Comment where are fish likely to reside?<n>they reside in water<n>Fish are aquatic<n>Fish are marine life<n><n>### Task solve<n><n>Where is a fish likely to reside?<n><n>None of the options above.<n><n>## Solution

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:James kept a clipboard where he could easily find  it.  Where might he keep it? Choices:  A: shelf B: place of work C: desk D: office supply store E: school<n><n>### Response:		<n>Clip board could be kept on the desk.<n><n>#### <n>Answer:<n><n>### Input1:The temperature in San Francisco on July 4 was 71 and there was a 20% chance of rain, but it didn’t rain on the 4th of July. At least what percentage of the days in July are expected to be sunny in San Francis<n>#### <n>Answer is D (50%).<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Demnstraion<n>Given that 4*(2y)+(2x) is the area of a rectangle, explain why the formula 2xy is the area of a square.<n><n>#### 4<n>### Answer<n>(4*2y)+(2*2y) is same when area of rectangle is  divided by the width of rectangle<n><n>So area of square 2xy<n><n>### Instrections:<n>Input1: What is it like to stand next to someone and talk to them? Choices:  D: uncomfortable A: okay B: good E: scary<n>Input2: Is it hard to get to school? Choices:  B: yes A: no E: yes<n>Input3: I enjoy eating spaghetti.  Which best describes you? Choices:  E: I like spaghetti A: I don’t like spaghetti<n><n>### Rationale:  I always feel comfortable talking to friends. There’s always great times. <n><n>B is right i don’t like it.<n>E is right I like spaghetti.<n><n>Answer:<n><n>#### <n>### Input1 is what? Explain why your answer is correct.<n>#### <n>Answer d (Uncomfortable).  <n><n>#### <n><n>### Draft a response that completes each instruction.<n><n>### Input2:<n>Is it hard to get to you school? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:Why shouldn't you walk barefooted after the rain? Choices:  A: shoes B: wet ground C: wet clothes D: start to fall E: water garden<n><n>### Response:		A: shoes<n>

He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:The doctor recommended washing hands, what was being promoted? Choices:  A, B, C, D, E, C: The answer is "C" which means that "A" indicates the presence cold hands<n><n>### Instructions: What is the relationship between the choices? For each choice, type "A" if the choice in the input is a synonym of the choice, type "D" if it is a dictionary for the choice, and type "I" if it is the input for the choice. For each letter, type "B" if it answers "is", type "E" if it answers "has", type "H" if it has the same letter of "I" in the beginning, and type "L" if it has the letter of "I". For each input, type "M" if it makes the choice the synonym of the choice (also known as "A"), type “N” if the input makes the choice the dictionary of the choice, and type “O” if it does not make either of the two choices.<n><n>#### Input:<n>A: A B: B C: C D: D E: E<n><n>#### Answer:<n>A<n><n>### Instinct:A new technology, Tesla Coil, is based off of the traditional coil.  How is Tesla coil different from traditional coil<n>### Instrucition:<n>Input: Cars are made from metal parts, wheels and glass windows Choices:  Metal, Parts, Wheels, Windows, Glass<n><n>### Response:"C" is the same to "Metal" <n><n>### Cars<n><n>### Instruption:<n>Input: <n><n>### Response:"E" is the same to the input<n>### Cars

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: Adam bought 3 kilograms of nuts and 2.5 kilograms of dried fruits at a store. One kilogram of nuts costs $12 and one kilogram of dried fruit costs $8. How much did his purchases cost?<n>Rationales: For the nuts Adam paid 3 * $12 = $<<3*12=36>>36.<n>And for dried fruits Adam paid 2.5 * $8 = $<<2.5*8=20>>20.<n>So in total for his purchases Adam paid $36 + $20 = $<<36+20=56>>56.<n>#### 56<n>Answer: 56<n><n>Input: Johns goes to the gym 3 times a week.  He spends 1 hour each day lifting weight. Additionally, he also spends a third of his weightlifting time warming up and doing cardio each day.  How many hours does he spend at the gym a week?<n>Rationales: He spends 60/3=<<60/3=20>>20 minutes warming up<n>So he spends 60+20=<<60+20=80>>80 minutes at the gym per day<n>That means he spends 80*3=<<80*3=240>>240 minutes at the gym<n>So he spends 240/60=<<240/60=4>>4 hours at the gym a week<n>#### 4<n>Answer: 4<n><n>### Input:The museum made an odd choice for the koala display, they put the stuffed creature in what area where you'd usually find a panda? Choices:  A: jungle B: bamboo grove C: australian outback D: china E: child's book<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Justification:Their choice to put the Koala displayed in an area where you'd find a Panda is completely odd as Koala's live in trees and are not native to panda habitats.<n><n>### Explanation:For a Koala we can find this is the jungle<n><n>### But as for a Panda what we tend to find is not the jungle but rather bamboo. <n><n>### So A is what we can find in the jungles and B is what we tend to find for pandas and C is not necessarily where we would find either but rather the AUSTRALIAN OUTBACK.<n><n>### Here is an image which can better illustrate my point<n>![A koala and a Panda](http://i.imgur.com/5LHU21k.jpg "A koala and a panda")<n><n>### I am not a wildlife conservationist but I did just take the liberty to take this image on Google for my personal reference
